text: Love their ice cream!  So different from store bought.  When it is hot in Vegas, this is a great place to cold down and indulge in their delicious sweet creations.  There was a line when we got there, but they did not have a good system so people do not jump the line.  They need to work on that, otherwise, they could have people who get offended.  The price is a bit high, but the quality is top notch.

Omg! The best ice cream ever! Get the four scoop sampler because it's too hard to decide on just one flavor! Now I know what you're thinking, "the four scoop? Oh that's too much! I really shouldn't!" Yes you should!! So many flavors, you have to try each one because even though you have probably had mint chocolate chip ice cream before, you've never had it like this! And you HAVE to have the buckeye! The ice cream is so creamy and rich it's hard to resist licking the plastic container your four scoops of deliciousness comes in, and ok, I almost did lick the container when I was done but a stranger would've seen me (my brother and sister in law would have to but they would understand and not judge me). Regular ice cream will never be the same.

The opening of this Handel's location has been a Divine Godsent gift from the heavens above. Oh, try the banana creme pie or graham central station. Those are amongst their best flavors. But really, if you want a taste of summer, Handel's delivers it well.
This is the creamiest ice cream I've ever tasted.. The taste is simply unique. Wish they had an actual done in area, it was pretty windy trying to eat our ice cream. But otherwise it was D'lish!!!

You can taste the quality! Now they don't have one on my side of town (probably a good thing...for my a$$ size) however, if you find yourself nearby, deff dont pass up! 

I fond this place on dollar cone day, which happen to be a Saturday..score right there. And you're thinking $1 cones *tiny*, nope..3 scoops atop a sugar cone (I tipped my scooper- that's how we do things in Vegas ya' know & he might have been a bit heavy-handed on my $1 cone)  - I'm not complaining! They seem to also have deals other days of the week too.

So 4 starts: The only thing I was disappointed in was the lack of seating outside. It's a walk-up window, which is fine, but non-existent seating is a dealbreaker. Lots of families, running, yelling kids (its an ice cream joint on $1 cone day right!?!) but the lack of seats made the commotion a little nerve racking for me. It was a nice day outside, I can only image what chaos summer will bring, I hope they invest in more seats...its like a missed opportunity on their part.

This place has tons of different flavors to choose from. If you're sick of the typical fro-yo places all around town give this place a chance and you won't be eating fro-yo again!  Spouse Like A House and Buckeye are the best two flavors.

Being from Youngstown, I was thrilled when I heard Handel's was opening in Las Vegas...and a mere two blocks from my house.  The new location reminds me of the ones in Y'town....walk-up windows, no seating....great ice cream.  Some are a little richer or sweeter than I'd like (choc.  peanut butter and chocolate raspberry truffle), so I stick with chocolate malt w caramel, banana creme pie, chocolate pecan, or chocolate marshmallow.

The only two downsides:  the walk-up and the wait. That said, that's how it is in Youngstown, so why expect different here?

I give Handel's 5 stars because I always search for a blueberry cheesecake and never get what I want. And Handel's Blueberry Cobbler ice cream hits the spot. So delicious.  Blueberry swirls and rich creamy sweet ice cream with cookie/pie pieces mixed in.  I'm a happy camper

I would rate them lower if their ice cream wasn't so good. I always get Oreo ice cream (simply because their board is overwhelming and I don't know what's in any of the funny nicknames for flavors) but I'm reluctant to come back because the customer service is always less than desirable. First, there isn't anywhere to sit because there are always people sitting on the ONE bench outside, so by the time I get home and comfortable to eat my ice cream, it's melted. Second, there is just a stupid window which makes you feel completely isolated from the person making your ice cream when they literally shut the window while you're talking. And last, the people always take forever. What are you doing back there? All you have to do is scoop the ice cream... I'm not just talking about something I don't know about... I work at coldstone, so I actually know how long it takes to ACTUALLY mix the ice cream. Theirs is pre made, so it makes no sense on why it takes so long... Their ice cream is good, but not worth waiting forever and getting the window shut on you

Lots and lots of fun flavors and good prices.  We tried the 4-flavor sampler and loved all four of the ones we tried.  Looking forward to going back and trying more.  I only wish they had an air-conditioned seating area!

Tried this place several times with several different flavors of ice cream.  Each time, I came away thinking the ice cream was average.  It is pretty soft...almost a hybrid of hard pack and soft serve, and melts pretty fast.  I would not say it has the high cream content of higher end ice creams.  Just does not have that special creamy goodness.

Coconut cream is my new favorite flavor!  So creamy with plenty of coconut flavor.   I have been here several times, and the ice cream never disappoints.  The banana splits are the best...traditional!   My only reason for dinging 1 star is the wait....sometimes it takes awhile to get your ice cream, especially if there is a line.

Cannot seem to figure out the best flavor. I am a Chocolate flavor person by heart. The banana split is waa√†aaaaa6yyyyyyyyyytyty too big. But the ice cream itself is nice and creamy and full of flavor. I like this joint but it gets busy and when you have kids just hanging all over you while you wait it is almost too much to wait for. Anyhow, this ice cream is worth it once it's your turn.

Solid ice cream creations.  Very friendly staff (and accommodating) and fast service.

Will be back

Who doesn't love ice cream on a boiling hot day? There are so many choices here, the worst thing about it is trying to decide which flavor to order! We went with banana cream pie, which was fantastic. Super creamy, really tasted homemade. 

I'd recommend doing the four scoop sampler, though, simply because you get to taste more delicious flavors!

Wonderful ice cream and the seasonal flavors make the experience even better! 

They get slow on tuesdays ($2 Tuesdays) but still worth the wait. The Peppermint stick and blueberry cobbler are my favorite.

Yaaayyy!!!!! It's finally here! I never thought it's going to happen. I've eaten so much ice cream in my life but Handel's is hard to beat!  For anyone who has no background of this wonderful treat, this hails originally from Youngstown, OH! They make everything fresh daily one batch at a time in every location! Now that's something to boast about being in existence for almost 70 years! 
I was 1st introduced to this deliciousness by my  husband about 7 years ago & that has left such an imprint in my head that whenever we get to go back to his hometown IT has to be the 1st pit stop before doing anything else .
 I think they're most popular for their Chocolate Pecan Ice Cream so it's just fitting that my 1st order for their opening day would be such & it did not disappoint! 
Thank you Mr. Patrick  for taking a chance to make this a reality for all the Handel's patrons in Las Vegas! Good luck & I hope it'll be here for years to come!
Now what are you waiting for? Get off your bottom, head out west & get your 1st lick & I'm sure it won't be the last!

I hate not giving this place a perfect review but the management team/owners need to know that some of their workers are cheats! 

I have a 2 year old that loves ice cream but he's not ready for the regular cones yet so the baby come they offer is perfect. He loves vanilla and it's the right amount. Every time my family goes there we order it for him and no problem, but today we were helped by a teenager/maybe early 20s kid who refused to give him any. He explained "the baby cones are for babies! He wants ice cream he needs a regular size!" I'm sorry but is the rule now only a infant can have a baby size cone? It wasn't even the matter of price because I know they offer the baby cones for free but if it was a big deal we would have paid for it because it's just the right size for him. But this guys literally refused! I don't know if he was trying to make money or thought we were taking advantage but it put a bad taste in my mouth!

My family loves this place. The ice cream is always good and perfect on any hot Las Vegas Sumer day! So the store itself deserves 5stars and most of the workers we met in the past are genuinely pleasant and seem like they love their jobs unlike the guy we had to unfortunately be helped by today!
Most amazing ice cream on the planet! Soo happy our hometown ice cream finally came to vegas!!! Yum!

This place seems busy usually but I can't understand why. It was dead tonight, Sunday at 7:30 pm. I've been here three times and it seems like the employees never know what they are doing. What's strange is they leave the dippers in the freezer which makes it impossible to scoop the ice cream. Each time I watch them struggle with trying to scoop the ice cream and get it out of the dipper. Have they never heard of a "dip well" that you leave the dippers in that trickles water so the scoops are always rinsed?

Tonight I got a banana split which is supposed to be a split banana (hence banana split) laid along the side of the three scoops in the container but only got a few slices dropped in beside the ice cream. Then he put the whipped cream on first before the toppings. Common sense should tell you this is wrong for anyone who's ever seen a picture of a banana split but he's an untrained teen so I can't blame him. For toppings, only a very awful tasting over portioned crushed pineapple and crushed maraschino cherries. Absolutely awful. And then no chocolate syrup and no nuts. Then he hands me the open container with the pineapple and crushed cherries spilling all,down the side from where he ineptly tried to put the toppings along side of the ice cream and whipped cream. Can't put it on top, whip cream came first. 

The last time I was there I got a hot fudge sundae and also no nuts and a smidgen of fudge. The way it looks is always unappealing. This is what happens when you turn your store over to be run by teenagers with attitude. They really don't care about what they are serving and when you're looking for a sweet treat to lift you up its quite frustrating to be served this crap.

They opened this store in a nice neighborhood with families that have probably a little more than the average families expendable income. If they provided a better customer experience, better product and presentation, they could get away with charging more. Serving poor quality product and giving poor service just because the price is low is not a mixture for success. 

I doubt I'll be back there.

This place is delicious.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 Stars was the seating situation.  If there was indoor seating it would be an easy 5 Stars.  The staff was friendly and patient as it took a while to read through all of the flavors.  I look forward to going back.
Yum! Great tasting ice cream. I have been here twice. Love $2 Tuesday even though the line is very long.
This place is a childhood favorite of mine. I am so happy that it is here in Vegas. I absolutely love their icecream. The staff is super friendly too.

This is my new favorite Ice Cream place! Handel's Home Made Ice Cream & Yogurt is a Walk up window service place. 
I was a bit overwhelmed with the menu. Tons of ice cream flavors & creations to chose from! They are constantly busy. Even with the busyness the staff still maintained good customer service. That's a bonus for me. 

Final three flavors were: Graham Central Station, Coconut Creme Pie & Butter Pecan. Each scoops were a very generous size. 
All I have to say is 3 words
Oh my goodness!!!

The ice cream was very creamy, full of flavor & I'm assured that it was all made with LOVE! 

Handel's is a must have!

PROS...Large variety of creamy flavors and ways to have your ice cream.  Vegan options.

CONS....It's a service window you walk up to, with outside seating only.  Depending on the time of day, you could be standing in a line with 15 people in front of you.  That's especially not fun in the sun with Vegas summers.  Prices are high.  Staff are sometimes not so friendly, seem pretty stressed, so maybe there's not enough staff.

Hands down the best ice cream in the world. Seriously. We move a lot and always make a point of finding the best ice cream and this outshines them all. Get the four scoop sampler and try the graham canyon and whatever else suits your fancy. You won't regret it and will probably find yourself buying a pint to take home like we do!

Feels and tastes like neighborhood ice cream shop that I remember growing up. Large selection, up beat employees, reasonable prices.  Can also take pint or quart to go. Thankful that they opened so close to our home.

Okay, so why was this gem hidden away from me for so long. Summerlins little secret.  The ice cream at this place is dangerous.   The flavors are rich, they're creamy and truly taste like they should.   Have you ever had something called "strawberry something" or "cherry whatever" but when you taste it you feel like you've been duped?  Well that won't be the case at Handel's.  I love the Graham Central Station, with chunks of graham cracker cookies,  a cinnamon-y vanillaish flavor with oodles of goodness in there...  good greif call 911.  But only call 911 after you've tried their Birthday Cake.  I wish it didn't have the sprinkles in it but the swirls of icing and the actual flavor are so good.  My suggestion is that you get the 4 scoop sampler.   The only thing is that if it's hot outside, you better eat up quickly,  lol

My Co-worker recommended this place. We finally got the chance to try it and when we pulled over, there were a few people in line and a few more eating their ice cream cones. My husband and I were eager to see what they have with the number of people around. We got the 4 scoop sampler, butter pecan, graham central station, NY style cheesecake, spouse like a house for less than $5, what a deal! The sampler was too much for the 2 of us. We will definitely be back and will bring friends & family if they are in town.

This place has some of the creamiest ice cream I've ever had! The pink champagne sherbet is my personal favorite item right now. FYI, You just order from a window, there is no indoor seating. They have a couple of benches nearby you can sit on outside.

This place is super great. I really like the huge portions for the small prices. Definitely want come back again. I really like the friendly employees and their ice cream was really creamy. If you are looking for a good dessert spot, I would highly recommend Handel's.

This place is hands down one of the best ice cream spots in the Valley! Fresh ingredients and super friendly staff. I recommend the four flavor sampler to a new-comer. So many delicious options and at very reasonable prices!
$ 2 ice cream on Tuesdays are the best!!!! They also have big servings!!! Best ice cream place here in Vegas!!! I tried the Graham flavor ice cream and it did not disappoint! Will come back again!

Really, really great ice cream.

Two of us each went with our own 4 scoop sampler. This is an incredible deal at $4.25, and they have so many flavors that it would seem impossible to choose just one. 

We tried the following:

Coconut Cream Pie -- Awesome. Really the best coconut ice cream out there.
Cake Batter -- Just cake batter ice cream. You can get this anywhere. Though, it does have a large amount of sprinkles.
Chocoholic Chunk -- Tastes remarkably similar to Haagen Daz. Also good but not my favorite. 
Butter Pecan -- Tons of pecans. They really aren't cheap with their additives, which makes for great ice cream. 
Buckeye -- Real mini buckeyes make this a good ice cream. I could use more of a peanut butter swirl or something, though.
Spouse Like A House -- Too malt flavored for me and not enough pretzel. This was my least favorite.
Salted Pretzel Crunch -- So good. You have to love caramel and love chocolate covered pretzels. Luckily, I love both. 
Graham Central Station -- By far my favorite. I don't even like honeycomb, but it was perfect in this ice cream.

This isn't the best location, and it would be cold in the winter to eat your ice cream outside, but I would definitely make the sacrifice in order to eat this ice cream.

Their 4 scoop sampler is great for trying many flavors.   My favorites are banana cream pie,  New York cheesecake and cookie and creme.  The syrup they use for strawberry cheesecake is a little too sweet for me.

I never have had a problem with this place! The ice cream is the best ice cream I ever had and everyone is always so nice when I buy something. I also just found out that sAbrina no longer works there which is a shame. She was always really excited to see me my kids and my dog and it made our visit extra enjoyable when we had our orders already made bevause she new what we wanted. That's to bad. But we still love going every employee has been very nice and helpful when we show up and the owmer is always involved which is good to see. Go try some ice cream now!!!!@
Delicious. Soft, fresh ice cream. Ordering at the window is nostalgic. Kitchen is clean. Portions are large. Yum!

Simply very good ice cream.  A wide variety of flavors, excellent size options and very good prices.  The servers were welcoming, offered advise and quickly transacted our purchase.  Just a very nice experience following our trip to Red Rock Canyon..

I live just down the street from Handel's and I go there all the time! Especially now that I'm pregnant, I go a couple times a week. When I first started going here, the ice cream used to be so amazing and filled with lots of chunks of whatever (cheesecake, cookie dough, etc.) But now it seems like they are getting pretty skimpy on the chunks of stuff. It's still good ice cream, don't get me wrong, but I just wish they didn't start being skimpy on the fillings. :(
I love coming here... Or even in Rancho Cucamonga. This place satisfies the sweet tooth
Walk up ice cream window. Best ice cream I've had since moving to Las Vegas. They have SOOOOO many flavors. There is usually a line but it is worth it. Make sure you try chocolate cake batter!
Great ice cream and a variety of choices.   This location is window service and they have. Few benches outside to sit on.  The lines aren't that bad except for 2 buck Tuesday.

This was our first time here. It was so good! I got the graham central station and that was so delicious!!! My husband got the brownie sundae ( not sure what's it called) but that was good too much whipped cream. Overall we will definitely be back!
Place was really awesome! A true Ice cream shop! Banana split was really complimtary with the diffrenet fruits they put on as toppings! They are actually Fresh!
Amazing. Worth the wait in line. Salted Carmel truffle and graham central station the best!!!
All I can say great homemade flavor ice cream. Nice customer service. Great specials and fresh ice cream. Open late night and quality on point. For sure give a try!
Went here got a 4 scoop sampler it was so yummy. Orange dream, strawberry cheesecake,  mango sorbet and banana cream pie. They are amazing!!!

First time here and loving it!!!!! This place is amazing they make fresh ice cream daily.. Why you ask, because they run out all the time! How can u go wrong. The owner is super cool and friendly I think he said Ohio. The proof is in the taste, it's so fresh and creamy. They have tons of flavors to choose from, the best day to go there is on Tuesday. It's two dollar scoop day all day long...... I will be back for more!! A-MAY-ZING

Updating my review - the ice cream is still good but I noticed last night that there are no descriptions of the flavors anywhere (even checked their website)... for common flavors such as cookie dough, or pistachio... those are obvious, but Blue Monster?? I suppose I could ask the employees what every flavor was and hold up the normally very long line but seems it would be beneficial to list the specifics of each flavor somewhere. Also another annoyance is that for the "small" cone/bowl, you get 3.5 scoops of ice cream but it can only be one flavor? Kind of dumb that you can't split flavors....

For the people who don't like this ice cream, well you must have a cow in the back yard and make your own. Best ever, maybe not, I would say the best in Vegas. Huge chunks and creamy deliciousness! I'm glad it's not closer to my house or I would be a few pounds heavier for sure.

I got the 4-scoop sampler with banana foster, blueberry cobbler, cookie dough and Oreo! Banana foster was the flavor of the month, would definitely grab that again, And the blueberry cobbler was crazy good. All of them were life changing ! Can't go wrong

3 words: GRAHAM CENTRAL STATION

Just try it, you can ask the staff for a little tasting spoon of it. And then you'll end up buying it by the pint.

Red raspberry sorbet is a close second, but when you want to indulge, GCS is the way to go.

Las Vegas has so many frozen yogurt and boba tea places, it's nice to have a go-to (real) ice cream destination that is quick, convenient and most importantly, delicious! Staff is super friendly and I love the story behind the brand.

Trop & Hualapai...I will be back soon :)

2 bucks Tuesday for the family and Coffee chocolate chip ice cream
 HEAVEN on Earth 

The staff is friendly and although the lines can get long they work fast and efficiently so your not waiting more than a few minutes. A great place to go to after dinner or Just for a treat  its worth the trip.

Definitely real ice cream! Probably some of the best in Vegas. Tried the banana split & loved that they actually used chocolate, strawberry & vanilla ice cream. Very large & covered in toppings. Great value too. Also had the 4 pack sampler & great to try different flavors. Loved them but thought the chocolate malt was really bland.

Best homemade ice cream! It is a stand, no indoor shop. Love that it is close by.. it has a variety of flavors including ice cream, shakes, ices and sorbets, sundaes.. you name it! they have pint and quart size options to take home as well & you can't forget about $2 Tuesdays! My favorite is Graham Central Station and Blueberry Cobbler. Cant wait to come back and try more flavors!

This is by far the best ice cream I have ever had!  My favorites are salted caramel truffle and the pretzel caramel ice cream. If I lived close to this place I would gain an extra 60 pounds. It's that good for real lol!  I won't eat any other ice cream here in Las Vegas. Hands down #1 in my book.
Some of the best ice cream I have ever tasted in life. NO JOKE
Absolutely love this ice cream shop! The service was friendly and the ice cream was smooth and flavorful. I recommend the 4 scoop sampler.
Homemade ice cream can't get any better than this! YUM!! I got a nerds on the moon hurricane... raspberry syrup, nerds, and vanilla ice cream blended

Happy to hear a new ice cream shop opened up nearby my house with homemade ice cream?! After seeing their flavor choices on yelp once they opened, I admit I was not really excited to try anything because the flavors all sounded basic, nothing unique. I had no urgency to try this place and I am sucker for homemade ice cream. 

I've tried it and I don't get the hype. 

4 scoop sampler- salted caramel truffle, chocolate chocoholic, oreo, peanut butter chocolate something. 

The ice cream- soft and creamy but not in a good way. In a way that it will melt within a few minutes. We tried to take it home and we live a mile away. As soon as I got into the car I noticed the flavors melting into one another since all 4 scoops were next to eachother in a small plastic container which had ridges. Not to sound too picky but with ridges it melts into the ridges making it harder to eat. I would prefer a styrofoam cup over the plastic with ridges. Flavors are not memorable. They taste is very sweet, very artificial, and not special in any way to make me return. 

Service: people mentioned 4 windows. I didn't see that. I saw 2 people working. One was cleaning and one was stressed taking orders. There is this window that slides open. It was awkward because the girl working there asked if I wanted a sample. She held the door open while talking to me and had a hard time holding it and writing it down on her little notepad at the same time. Her awkwardness made me feel like helping her. I find that sliding window annoying because it stops the interaction much like a drive through window. If the ice cream was $1 a scoop I can see it being acceptable. But for $3.50 a scoop I would expect to have a place to sit (although there was a bench or two,one family of 4-5 people took over that area) and to be able to interact more with the person giving me the ice cream. Anyway I wanted two samples. She wrote one down halfway and the other she didn't write down. I never saw someone write a sample down. When she went to get it, she forgot the one she did not write down. I thought that was kind of sad. But she must have been overwhelmed because when she went to give me my ice cream I noticed her entire backside of her arm had blue ice cream smeared over it as it was dried on so it was there for a while. Gross! Take some time to wash your hands people. That's not ok.  

The sliding window showed even more awkwardness as she was unable to get me spoons and my ice cream without it slamming on her while my ice cream would have been thrown aside if she let the sliding glass door go. I just wanted to get out of there but I noticed she didn't give me napkins nor did I see any outside on the counter. I think napkins are a must for customers to have access to in Vegas summer heat.
Vegas really needed a place like this on the West side.   The ice cream is super flavorful.   Creamy but not too rich.  The service was great too. Good place for my teens to go on a date.

How could anyone not like this place? They have 25+ flavors of ice-cream and the prices are reasonable. 
They even have dairy-free options. 
I'm not an ice cream connoisseur, so perhaps the texture isn't perfect, but it's ice cream and it's good.
The best ice cream and yogurt! Yummy they have so many flavors to choose from. And are open all year round. Love two buck Tuesday.

Ice cream heaven...

Ever wonder what it's like to go to ice cream heaven? This is it folks.

This place makes homemade ice cream and you can taste it. I've been trying all sorts of flavors and my favorite hands down is the graham central station which is for anyone who enjoys golden graham cereal and graham cracker crust. Luscious perfection...

They have tons of flavors. They make every type of sundae, milkshake, smoothie, whatever you so please and honestly I haven't tasted anything I haven't liked yet. Second favorite would be the chocolate marshmallow and the marshmallows are so fresh & soft that it's mind blowing. 

For anyone looking for an extra deal, come on a Tuesday for $2 scoops. The scoops here are HUGE. 

I'm a big time fan & have become a regular!

Handel's....Yum!  My girlfriend and I ate here every Tuesday for $2 buck Tuesday and my husband brings home a quart or pint every other week or so. 
My absolute favorite is the coffee chocolate chip. I seriously can't get enough of it.
Maybe a rewards card would be nice.

This is the number 1 homemade ice cream in  Las Vegas !!!  Fresh ingredients, smooth, creamey and Delicious.
Handles was my only ice cream parlor in youngstown ohio while growing up the lines were around the building every day of the week. Now I am so excited to have one here and is a short walk to get there, you got to go and see for yourself.

I grew up eating Handel's in Youngstown, OH and tonight was just like being home on a summer night! The Black Cherry and Chocolate Pecan haven't changed from my childhood. The boyfriend had cake batter and he said it was too sweet & he has a HUGE sweet tooth.  The only down side is that there was no napkins outside to clean up the ice cream drips.  

What I don't think people understand who have left 2 or less stars. Where Handel's was started it was about socializing with the neighborhood. You sat on the curb or leaned on cars trying to finish your ice cream before it ran down your arm.  So don't worry about the fact there is no indoor seat and instead start a conversation with the person next to you.
Unreal ice cream. The shopping center is also a great place to sit and enjoy a come after a day in the park or at work. Tons of flavor selections and top shelf service!!
As one who grew up in Ytown (gone 36 years) glad to find Handel's while on vacation.   Ice cream was awesome.  Next trip this will be my first stop from the airport.

Yum Yum Yum.  No joke my fave ice cream... they have about a million flavors... some with obscure names and no descriptions... so thats kinda a bummer... what does "spouse in the house taste like?" but the graham central station is to die for.  I like a good gram cracker... but would never think I wanted it as an ice cream flavor... but after seeing so many yelpers talk about it I had to try... A-Maz_ing!!!

On a hot day, there are few things better than a scoop (or three) of homemade ice cream.

Whether you visit for $2 two scoop Tuesday or any day for 4 scoop samplers for $4.25, Handel's does not disappoint. 

My top flavor picks: Blueberry Cobbler, Banana Cream Pie,Graham Central Station, and Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough

Only downside: Outside seating only...

Don't be discouraged by the long lines, they move fast.

I wasn't WOWED by this ice cream or the experience at Handel's.  The chocolate with peanut butter cups was very rich.  I wouldn't order it again.  I will give this another try when the weather is warmer and they have all the kinks worked out.

First visit to Handle's. Large menu to choose from. The Apple dumpling was extremely good. Great dough!  The banana split hurricane not so much. I feel like it needs more banana, some chocolate and some nuts. Very friendly staff. We will try it again some time.

I ordered the four scoop sampler since this was our first visit. Butter pecan, birthday cake, vanilla turtle and chocolate marshmallow were all very good. With the hot weather on the way we will definitely be back to try more.

Honestly I wasn't impressed. :( I really wanted to like this place.  This had been book marked on yelp for a while now....

Well I gotta say -1 star for the lack of service. The girl that came to the window was prompt.... But when I asked to sample a third flavor since they like a bazillion flavors... She kind of gave me a look like..."geez make up your mind already.". I didn't appreciate the look.... But I came here to get over cream so I got some. 

-1 star also cuz it was pretty much a stand.... No place to sit and enjoy the ice cream.  Maybe I missed it on yelp somewhere but I did not know that they had no place to sit. :( 

The flavors were OK. They didn't pop like I wanted them to. They tasted like gourmet ice cream that u could buy at the store.  Texture was OK. It was creamy but only after I left it sit for a bit. 

But it is a great deal for your buck. I got their special.... 4 scoops for under $5... Good deal.

Would I go back? Maybe if I was in the area craving ice cream. But would I drive here specifically for the ice cream.... Probably not when I have Gelatology so much closer to me.

So more like 2.5 rounded up to a 3.... Just middle of the road. It wasn't great but it wasn't horrible either.

The ice cream is good but I give the three stars because the staff just seems to really lallygag and just hang around back there while everyone waits outside. They make the milk shakes with a lot of milk and a little ice cream. Maybe the whole experience will be better on another day. I'll give it another chance some other time.

I mentioned ice cream earlier in the day because it was hot. When we were on our way home, my girlfriend asked if I still wanted ice cream- of course since that's her second favorite thing after tacos. (3rd is pizza). As we were driving from northwest past Summerlin to southwest, I kept refreshing Yelp to find near locations. I wanted to try something different and not the typical brand ice cream places. I found this place and was excited because I never heard of them, they have homemade ice cream, they had good reviews and they were only 4min from the freeway. 

We got the 4 flavor scoop. Strawberry cheesecake, pistachio, their flavor of the month- key lime and Oreo. It was all really smooth. Next time we know we'll be fine with just 2 scoops of Pistachio! We put the leftover in the freezer for later. 

I'm not a fan of really sweet things and Pistachio was the least sweet of them and strawberry Cheesecake was the most sweet. I could try their no sugar added ice cream next time too. I wish they had a vegan ice cream flavor- I would be all over that! 

She asked if we found a new ice cream spot. I said no! Because ice cream isn't good for you, we shouldn't be eating it like that. She said once a month is ok.

Handel's is finally open, bringing gourmet ice cream from Ohio (of all places!) to the Vegas valley. When I say gourmet, I'm not even kidding- they have a rotating list of nearly 50 phenomenal flavors, making it hella difficult to make your choice. The only solution is to come here frequently!

Torn between peanut butter parfait or salted caramel truffle, the guy at the window recommended the latter- and it was downright divine. Smooth, salty caramel ice cream, with chunks of sea salt caramel truffles. For a regular price of $3.50/scoop (cone or cup), it was indulgent.

Service is friendly, be advised that the location is a walk-up window NOT a dine-in establishment. Same plaza as Smith's, closer to the Great Harvest Bread Co.

I'm very happy I found this place. It's open somewhat late which is nice for those like me who's sweet tooth kicks in when the sun drops.

The ice cream is very creamy. I usually get the Butter Pecan in a cake cone. The pecans are very large and, in my opinion, always has a perfect ratio between the ice cream.

If you're coming in at night, just walk up to the window and order. I think you'll be very satisfied with it. If you've had better, then consider yourself fortunate.

The ice cream here is amazing! Easily the top ice cream I've had in vegas so far. They have tons of flavors... My husband and I both got a four scoop sampler. I tried the salted caramel truffle (my favorite!!), the cookie dough, the banana cream pie which really tastes like its name, and the chocolate marshmallow. My only suggestion would be to make the chocolate marshmallow more marshmallow-y, it's just the chocolate ice cream with marshmallows in it and I was expecting more throughout. My husband got plain chocolate and vanilla, cotton candy, and the watermelon ice. Usually, ice has no taste but this one was so tasty! I can't wait to go back and try more. They also gave my toddler a free baby cone of vanilla. The prices are really great, we spent $9 and change and I gave the girl a $10 and told her to keep it and she was super grateful just for that little tip. I highly recommend this place, it was perfect to sit outside at nice with my family and enjoy a treat.

This place is Da bomb.com I love it so much. The milk in the ice cream tastes like it comes from Heavenly cows in pastures in Pennsylvania. You can only imagine what this must taste like when this ice cream touches your mouth for the first time it is simply delectable.
$2 Tuesday!. Don't miss out. Great deal, friendly service and great ice cream.  You can eat outside while watching people licking ice cream off their shirts!

The ice cream was excellent! It's a walk up window with a list of a million flavors. Ask the staff for a sample they'll get right on it. Ask for more than a few they get cranky lol I mean who wouldn't. The walk up window takes away the experience I mean when you see the ice cream it's so much easier to decide and know what you want. Like (Thrifty's, Cold Stone, Baskin Robbins, etc...) it's a bummer because their Ice Cream is so much better than all those competitors! They have the store space so maybe in the future.
Omg. I'm. In. Love. Homemade ice cream. We recommended this spot already to at least two dozen families. You HAVE TO try Handel's. Unbelievably Awesome. First time my husband was rendered speechless.

I don't have to try it to tell you how much I LOVE it....My Dad grew up in Youngstown OH and his parents and my grand parents took us there ALL the time....This is what I grew up on. I will defiantly be switching ice cream spots and taking my kids and grand kids. THANKS Handel's for all the great memories :)
If you can't decide the 4-scoop sampler is the way to go. Have yet to have a flavor we didn't like!!

I love Handels. We have tried the Handels in Encinitas, CA and now the store in Las Vegas. The ice cream is the best. A bazillion flavors and my favorite is the Grand Central Station.
Recommend this Ice Cream to all ice cream lovers

Same great taste. I remember going to a Handel's ice cream shop in Montclair, California. This is the same franchise I believe. I ordered the banana cream pie sundae and it was so fresh and creamy. It was the right consistency of melty, creamy and a good amount of sweetness on my tongue. The banana cream pie had little chunks of crust and a hint of banana flavor. This place has so many other flavors to choose from. We are coming back for sure...
OOOHH, MA GAAWWD! This place is the best EVER!!! My new favorite ice cream place. I LOVE LOVE ice cream! It's my favorite food group! YUM!!!

Best Ice Cream Ever!! 

We drove here because it was recommended while in Vegas. Although it's a hike from the strip, it was well worth the time & gas. 

We tried:
Birthday Cake - my fave! & hands down the best I've ever tasted. Period. 

Oreo - delicious! 

Pistachio - O.M.G. That's all I'll say. 

Banana Cream Pie - Yum! 

Key lime pie - delish! 

The flavor I will try when i come back to Vegas is Bananas Foster.

Banana Cream Pie is the best hands down! I would give this place 5/5 but I was there last Friday and they only had 4 people working ... I had to wait over 15mins in line. Other then that this place is awesome!

I first heard of Handel's Ice Cream from my bf. We decided to try the place since his dental professor claims it's the best ice cream in town! 

There was a line when my bf and I arrived at the location. I quickly noticed that Handel's was not your typical ice cream shop. Instead, they had two windows for placing your orders and a bench for sitting on the side. We didn't mind waiting in line, since there were so many flavors to choose from and the line seemed to move fairly quick. I ordered the "4 flavor sampler" that had butter pecan, birthday cake, cookies & cream, and rocky road. I was really impressed on how creamy the ice cream was, especially for the butter pecan!

Pros:
-$2 Tuesdays
-Bigger Scoops (in a cone - except for the "4 flavor sampler")  
-Good Service
-Affordable price for ice cream (awesome for those on a college budget!)

Cons: No place to really sit

Although I am lactose intolerant, I still make occasional stops for that butter pecan & waffle cone! Just pop in some lactose pills and you're good to go! I've tried Blue Bell & Cream... in my opinion, it still does not compare to the quality of Handel's Ice Cream.

The many, many different homemade flavors is what got my attention. The way the flavors are created makes me curious. Love the way they serve it too. The old school walk up window makes it different. Creates a different appeal and expectation for their patrons. Tries the strawberry cheesecake and blueberry cobbler. Served on a waffle cone, it was a real treat!

They also serve hurricanes, sherbert, sundaes and pops!

The line is usually pretty long, we got lucky but be prepared to wait, especially during the summer.
FANTASTIC! This place is ON POINT! Super great ice cream, very creative offerings. Just say no to 31 Flavors and get the REAL DEAL here!
Love this place! The ice cream reminds me of back home! Finally found the blueberry was my favorite! The 4scoop sampler is always a winner!
Best ice cream in town! Great service and so many flavors to choose from. I never go anywhere else!!

Ice Cream: Pleasantville Edition. Coming to this ice cream shop gave me flashbacks to an old place I visited in Kansas City when I was just 15 or 16 years old. It really doesn't seem to fit in the modern age, and I love that.  There is no establishment to enter, just windows that face the outside so they can take your order and hand your dessert off. There are some metal benches outside, but they aren't comfy. I took off a star because I would appreciate some seating so that this could be a date night. At the moment its just kind of a pick-up and go home place. Still, if I am completely honest, the vibes I get from ordering at the window are cool. All the employees are friendly and chill (get it?). Actually, I think I will give that star back. I would like chairs, but I appreciate them for what they are.

Judging by their other locations, it looks like they originated in Ohio. I am so ecstatic they chose to start up a shop in our own little city of Vegas! Do yourself a favor and get the sampler. You get four very decently sized scoops so you can try more than one flavor for only slightly more cash than a single scoop. Boyfriend and I always do the sampler! My favorite flavor is Ore-Dough. It's an Oreo/Cookie Dough mix that gets everything right! It isn't listed on their website so they may be late at updating.

Never got to taste the ice cream.  Waited in line behind one person for 5 minutes and left.  All they wanted was an ice cream cone.  Perhaps the employees should be focused on customers instead of talking among themselves.  And this was at 1:30 on a Sunday afternoon. I can get bad service anywhere. I won't be going back.

Best ice cream ever...I'm totally hooked. They're located right next to Smith's and I just can't resist. There is always a new flavor to try and it's always so good. They have $2 Tuesdays which always draws a crowd in the evenings.
Great selection, but slow service, and no line order. Waited 35 minutes for a banana split and only two people in front of me. Ice cream melts... No urgency!

I was born and raised in Ohio so I am very familiar with this place and I gotta say I was so happy to find one here and they lived up to my expectations! Omg their ice cream is amazing! The only thing I could recommend is there someone be at the window or watching the window because we stood there for awhile before getting helped and maybe putting some type of seating outside... a bench or two! I hope they make more locations here in Las Vegas because it's a very far drive for me! I would visit more if there was a closer location!!! Great ice cream I loved the flavors and they have an amazing selection of ice creams to choose from! Can't wait to visit again!

Love, love, love this ice cream and you will too. Tried key lime today, so good with chunks of like graham cracker crust. The Pink Champagne was delicious too. The servers are always nice, patient and helpful when it comes to wanting to sample. Get yourself over there for some good ice cream.
I am from Youngstown OH!!!  This was where we went... All the time. BEST ice cream EVER. Your first time you must try Chocolate Pecan!!!!  You will keep going back... Take a quart home!!

I was surprised to this is a walk up place with no seating. We went on a weekend evening and the line was 10 minutes long easy. They had two windows open taking orders and moved through the line efficiently, there was just a lot of people. The ice cream was amazing! Highly recommend and the line is worth it.

I love this place. 

I was a little turned off at first by a few things: One, this is an outdoor place. You go up to the window to order and there are only benches outside to eat at (which are really hot in the summer, so we ended up eating in our car with the air on). Two, some of the flavors have strange names, so you don't know what they are unless you ask. Three, it was kind of a long wait and there weren't that many people there.

But, the good outweighs any negatives here. The staff are very helpful. I asked what some flavors were and they were happy to tell me. They gave us samples of the flavors we wanted to taste. I asked one employee for her recommendation on a flavor, and I'm so glad I did. We got the four flavor sampler, and that's the way to go. It's around $4.25 for four scoops of ice cream. We had strawberry, a graham cracker flavor, a black raspberry flavor, and salted carmel truffle. All of which were incredible. I would highly recommend eating here.

This is my kids favorite stop after a baseball game at The Mesas Park. We would be giving them a five star rating but their service is a little bit slow. But don't let that deter you, the quality of their ice cream is well worth the wait.

WOWWWWW this place straight killed the game!! i love the classic walk up window vibes..and the homemade ice cream was on point! i got the 4 sampler with banana cream pie, peanut butter chocolate brownie, birthday cake, and blue moon.. sooo bomb

I would wait an eternity or drive a thousand miles for this stuff!!!! Crack on a cone!
It was nice to see families getting together to enjoy some ice cream on a hot night and standing in line talking to each other about what to choose while they waited for their time at the old fashioned outside window.
So far I've tried Bananas Foster, Butter Pecan, Salted Carmel Pretzel and Graham Central Station-Holy Cow! Not a bad one in the bunch!!!!
***Bonus***next door is Anna's Italian Bistro which is excellent!!!! Save room for dessert and step next door to Handels-truly a perfect evening!
Bomb! The graham cracker ice cream was the best. Everything was fresh and everyone was really friendly. I love how they have such a wide range of flavors.

Very good but a little pricey. Come for 2 buck Tuesday and problem solved. I love the buckeye ice cream, peanut putter, fudge and vanilla ice cream swirl with buckets candies yummmmm. You have to stop by if you're looking for a delicious dessert destination

I love Handel's ice cream!!  My friend and I had gone to lunch and decided to stop by to get one of their delicious ice cream cones to top off a nice afternoon.  When we walked up to the window we saw a woman in the back.  We waited patiently for her to come up to the window.  Two more customers walked up.  My friend knocked on the window to get her attention,  nothing.  The other customer also knocked but nothing.  When they walked away I called the business, but it was just an automated machine.  After waiting 15 minutes we decided to leave.  Very disappointed with the lack of service.  Maybe there should be more than one person working behind the counter.

I'm not sure how any one can give less than 5 stars! Delicious, rich, home made ice cream. Get the 4 scoop sampler for $4.25 and try a few flavors. Yum! My suggestions are the Graham Central Station, Blueberry Cobbler, and Banana Cream Pie  And- it's a walk up order/pickup window.. so sit outside and enjoy

I'm not sure how I had never heard of Handel's prior to last week, but alas  someone told me about it and it didn't disappoint.  

I kidn of dig their set up. Just 4 walk up windows, no inside seating, but you can see where all the magic happens through the window. It is a little odd not looking at the ice cream as you make your selection. Given some of the odd names it can be tough to know what's what. However, I tried two samples and they were super cool providing them. Cost for a cone is less than Baskin Robbins and on Tuesday's I learned they have $2 scoops. If I lived closer I would definitely hit this place up on the regs. Being in the Henderson/Green Valley area that's just not possible.

For my maiden voyage I went with an old classic, Cookies & Creme. Or I think it was Oreo chunk, something along those lines. The pics from fellow Yelpers is what put it over the top for me. They are not shy with the Oreos, which is how all versions of this ice cream should be. Super creamy, Oreos were soft. And while there were a lot, they were spread out, so you didn't just eat the Oreo then have none for the rest of the journey. It was perfect. My wife went with the Cookie Dough and it was disappointing. Not a ton of dough and a little blah-zay. She loved my selection though.

Cool place, good ice cream. If in the area I'd definitely stop by!

Handels we love coming here. Your ice cream is top notch but your customer service has slipped and fast. With no line tonight and orders for 2 hot fudge sundae why could not the team chip in and help make the 2 orders? Instead we stand around as 2 employees look at social media sites and take pictures. Poor service makes me question coming back.

The ice cream is good, but the service is terrible.  We were in the area and decided to pick-up 2 quarts (cocount cream pie and oreo).  The problem is that we had to wait 20 minutes to get our order, for a line that was 6 deep and 3 guys working behind the counter.   If you decide to go, you can have my space in line we won't be back.

Love this place! I tried the 4 sampler for 4.50. It was well worth it as I enjoyed trying their unusual flavors such as heavenly hash, buckeye, graham central station, and coconut cream pie all of which were delicious but my favorite wax the heavenly hash! Great place to take the kids! Only down side, the indoor seating and they only have two benches outside so having a place to eat your ice cream can be a problem.

Handel's easily has some of the best ice cream in Vegas!  Everything is made daily and there is a wide variety of flavors and options when it comes to enjoying everyone's favorite cold treat.  Also, great value with $2 Tuesdays!  Be prepared to stand in line!

My family and I love this place.  We're here almost every week.  However, there is no sit in area and the lines can get really long, especially during the summer and during normally busy times like Saturday evening. Small price to pay for some scrumptious ice cream!

The ice cream here is only so so. They have rented out a huge place. You cannot go inside. You must place your order at a window that a woman opens. There are NO restrooms. NO place to sit. Not customer friendly. Maybe the business should relocate to a place that people can enjoy sitting down.

Graham Central Station - enough said. Homemade daily, quality ice cream with the BEST mix-ins. I can't even tell you what's in Graham Central except that it is by far the best one we've tried. I'm not a graham cracker lover either. It's seriously just the best - try it. Not that any of the others are not good- they're all INCREDIBLE. It's only that I dream of Graham Central and try to find ways to "reward" my children (myself) by bringing them here. 

There's also $2 Tuesday where you'll get a GIGANTIC scoop of ice cream (when they say single scoop, it's pretty much the size of a double or triple) for $2. 

Lastly, we once ran into Dan Reynolds (lead singer of Imagine Dragons) here and I really really wanted my kids to say hi (ID is their favorite band and they know every song off of both CDs) but were too shy. So, next time you're in the mood for ice cream - come here, get a Hot Fudge Sundae with Graham Central & nuts. You're welcome!

Ive driven by this place multiple times while picking my kids home from school but never checked it out. It wasn't until a friend of mine said they had the best ice cream ever. I decided to check it out and I have to say Im hooked. Best ice cream hands down. The flavors are so good and the ice cream is super creamy. It sucks that theres no seating and the the service is quite slow, but i would deal with it just for the ice cream.

Your Green Tea ice cream is amazing.  It's one of the best in the US.  I can really taste the matcha flavor.  Please do not discontinue this flavor.  You have no idea how difficult it is to find a good green tea ice cream.
Homemade ice cream, can't really beat that. With tons of flavors to choose from!!! And there arent every many locations on the west coast either! Very delicious!

This ice cream is crazy good. We came here in the freezing cold and I was not thrilled about standing outside in line to get it......but boy o boy was it worth it. I think this is the best ice cream I've ever had in my life and I'm a fat kid that's had A LOT of ice cream.

I don't eat a lot of ice cream, when I do fresh McConnell's is my favorite.  what is perfect ice cream? The perfect  balance between sweetness, creaminess and texture is different for everyone so there is no right or wrong answer. This hits the spot for me and I don't have to go to California to get it. So good I ate all 4 flavours in the sampler by my self! 

I tried blueberry cobbler which didn't taste like a cobbler, just blueberry. 
Coffee chocolate chip, which was my favorite, tasted like a late rather than boring drip coffee. 
Spouse like a house (I know right) this one is a little more elaborate with peanut butter cups, peanut  butter ripple and chocolate covered peanut butter filled pretzels. The pretzels are chocolate covered so they, maintain their crunch unlike others that get soggy or stale. 
Caramel pretzel had the same chocolate covered peanut butter filled pretzels with a Carmel ribbon. Subtle and perfect.
Bring on the food coma!
Love this place!! The ice cream is delicious and $2 Tuesday is definitely my favorite!
Been to many ice cream shops, from coast to coast and by far this chain has the best chocolate shakes.. It's trouble we live up the street from this place!!
Cinnamon roll shake was amazing!!! As well as the chocolate PB. Prices are fair. I'll definitely be back again.

Holy crap this ice cream is amazing!! Also, the store is incredibly clean!!! Never seen a place so well taken care of. Excellent choice and definitely worth the drive! I drove 30 minutes to get here. Try it!!

5/5 for flavor but unfortunately I did take away a star for the experience.   I had no idea there was no seating and it was an order up place. Guess I should have read some reviews.  Let me clarify there was a few benches that a bunch of kids were jumping off of and their clueless parents didn't care.  Another annoying thing was the sign location of their flavor choices...TO ALL PARENTS: please be advised that when you prop you child or children on the counter in front of this sign it makes it very difficult for other to view.  Staff was friendly and the four flavors we sampled were amazing!  Just wish I was able to enjoy it not sitting on a curb with tons of kids around.

Our little quick date night Handel Ice Cream
located on Tropicana and Hualapai.
one day i went to repair my vacuum next door to Handel Ice Cream. i never pay attention to that place till i saw that long long line of people.
i was wondering what they were waiting for. seriously the line was as long as the little nuts waiting to enter best buy on black friday.
the lady in line told me "¬†Best ice cream ever¬†"
Of course you CAN'T walk away from ice cream so i waited like everyone in line.
25mns later (people in line were not even bitching or mad like you would think!)
the place is uncommon.
the servers are all inside and you order from outside. they serve you through the sliding window.
price is super cheap and the ice cream delicious!
many many flavors!
i always go for pistachio or black cherry, kids for oreo, orange sherbet
they give you a really nice serving not like other place
on tuesdays they do $2 ice cream 
must try it, i promise you will be surprised
i though my favorite ice cream places was cold stone, golden spoon well i am adding Handel Home Made ice Cream

Handel's is the best Ice cream in town! It's made fresh and in small batches! Pick a flavor and you CAN'T go wrong! My favorite is peanut butter parfait, but they are all delicious! Tuesday night's special is $2 a scoop (and their scoops are BIG)! You may wait in a long line, but it's worth it! We also love the 4 pack sampler, which is pretty much like getting your cake (or ice cream) and eating it too!

Hands down best ice cream in vegas! Got to try their Mint chocolate chip, salted caramel truffle and blueberry cobbler. All amazing. Location is clean and staff is very friendly. Store bought ice cream has nothing on them. Can you handle HANDEL'S???
I'm not a sweets guy and certainly not an ice cream guy...but there is a reason National Geographic voted them best ice cream in the country!!!

It was just ok for me, I come from Chicago and we have a lot of old school ice cream parlors there so im kinda biased.  As for Vegas ice cream parlors it does the job...their ice cream is very creamy and they have variety of flavors. My disappointment was when I ordered a shake and asked for it extra thick only because there on the sign you can get it extra thick with a $.75 charge. Upon getting the shake I found it to be really liquidy, maybe that's what they considered thick... my definitions of extra thick is when you need to eat with a spoon. The prices are a tad high for the amount of ice cream you receive and the best day to go is $2 Tuesday. Wish they had more seating areas as well. Overall, this place is not bad but nothing more than 2 stars from me.  Its good for those hot summer nights and you want to bring the fams out for a treat.  I guess for family bonding time.  Check it out... you might like it!!

If you find yourself in this plaza running errands, then notice a long line of folks eagerly awaiting ice cream, you've found Handel's. Handel's only does window orders, so there's no building to enter. The order window closing on you as the employee grabs your order is a bit off-putting at first, but you get used to it, it's basically a "walk-thru" instead of a drive-thru experience. There are a few benches outside if you'd like to sit down and enjoy your treat, or you could always pick up a pint to take home. Our first visit was a bit of a revelation that we had been missing out. I got a single waffle cone of mint chocolate chip and my husband got the graham central station. When they say "single", they really mean way more than one scoop. The waffle cone was delicious, and I ended up leaving a scoop of ice cream in a bowl and popping it in the freezer for safe keeping. My husband has already been craving his graham central station selection. The girl helping us was very friendly and happily let us sample a few items since it was our first time. She told us their most popular flavors are the graham central station and the butter pecan. I did eventually go back and try the butter pecan, but found it way too buttery, while my mom thought it wasn't buttery enough (she's crazy lol). There are a lot more things for us to try here so it'll be nice to pop in here over the summer when it's hot outside.

Pro Tip - expect long lines for their 2 Buck Tuesday specials

If you aren't coming here and you're even remotely a fan of ice cream....you're f**king up! The four scoop sampler (only $4.25) of the best ice cream you've ever put I your face is a must...I am more than a customer, I am a raving fan! Beyond quality product, great service, killer price...

I love this place! When I came here I thought it was a walk-in ice cream shop but it's actually more like a take out stand. They have such a large variety of ice cream flavored and the four scoop sampler is the best deal. 

My top flavors are pistachio, peanut butter parfait, praline pecan, and cheesecake. The best thing about their ice creams is that each ice cream flavors have the actual food in it. For example, cheesecake has cheesecake bites and pistachio has actual pistachios, etc. 

My least favorite ice cream flavor was Reese's peanut butter cups. I avoided getting the Reese's pieces one because I don't like Reese's pieces. I got the peanut butter cup expecting it to have crushed up peanut butter cups but instead, it was crushed up Reese's pieces! I don't know if the girl got my flavor wrong since she only remembered one out of my four flavors and had to ask again, but that was the only disappointing part of my meal.

Overall this is my new favorite ice cream place and I would always come back here for ice cream! Especially now that the Vegas heat is increasing!

Where do I start?? 
I LOVE   ice cream  and my cousin (Anika C.) took my daughter and I here for a 4th of July special treat in Redondo Beach, CA. There are numerous flavors to fit your fancy from Vanilla with Oreo (my fav) to Buckeye and Graham Central Station; the flavors are endless and delicious. We were able to get a sample to tease our taste buds until we made it home. 
Don't let the line intimidate you...it goes by fairly quickly, once you try the ice cream you will understand why there is a line. This establishment has a walk up window to order your delectable creamery which gives it a nostalgic feel. On Tuesday's scoops are $2.00, you can purchase a pint to take with you and they have handle pops and so much more. We get the 4 scoop sampler so we can continue to try new flavors...which have not happened yet because we are satisfied with Birthday Cake, Cookie Dough, Vanilla w/ Oreos, and chocolate peanut butter brownie!!!
This will be my new ice cream spot for many moons to come!!!

Yeah it's back to inconsistency. Some mixes must be harder to get right than others.

 I've had bad interactions with other businesses because of my lackluster reviews BUT I haven't had a bad interaction with them. And I'd like to keep it that way. 

If they serve you something, and it's not to your liking, they'll fix it. They try to do a good job. 

And I get it. It's homemade and hand-scooped so all the servings can't be uniformly good. But it's frustrating to buy a quart or a pint or some scoops and get home and it not be what you wanted. The 4.5 star overall rating shows that plenty of ppl *are* getting what they want so take my review with a grain of salt. If the flavor sounds appealing try it (especially on Tuesday) and *you* will probably like it. This review is just a reflection of how I feel - not a anything that should carry more weight than the multitude of five star reviews for this spot.
The best ice cream in Vegas!  Great Staff!  The 4 Scoop Sampler is the perfect choice for the newby or ice cream lover!  Something for anyone in the family!

I finally was near this ice cream shoppe so my daughter & I decided to go. She went up to the board & called me w/flavors, (as I am unable to walk w/o a scooter while recovering from surgery). There had to be at least 30 to choose from. It just happened to be $2 Tues for a very generous scoop of ice cream. I found their prices to be quite reasonable especially compared to Cold Stone. I tried the four sampler ($4.25 + tax) and a qt of half cherry vanilla & half butter pecan ($7.50 + tax). My daughter got a scoop for her daughter-Oreo-to go for the two dollars (she is 8 & had some last nite & tonite & has enough left for dessert tomorrow nite!). She bought add'l flavors for her hubby & herself. We thoroughly enjoyed our treats. I recommend giving them a try. I'm sad they are a ride from where I live but happy on the other hand b/c I'd weigh a ton if they were any closer. We will go back b/c it's worth the ride a few times a year! Yummmm.

We just discovered this place and we really like it.  The ice cream is very excellent and of all the flavors we have tried I have to say chocolate pecan is by far superior.  On Tuesdays they have two buck Tuesday where all regular cones are $2. Keep in mind a regular cone is not small so it's a really good deal.  As other yelpers have said be prepared to wait because they are kinda slow. Overall with these hot vegas nights Handel's is a great place to cool down with a great treat.

Hands down, the best ice cream in Las Vegas. Quality taste that can't be beat. There's a large variety of really good flavors, but my favorites are the oreo hurricane and chocolate milkshake. The service is also very efficient and friendly. It's a very family friendly location as well, kids, dogs and all.

You wouldn't think that a walk up ice cream shop would work in Las Vegas because it's SO HOT people are trying to get out of the heat... but it does.

Best ice cream in town.

Saw the hype about this place opening and finely took my grandkids. Got there just after 11am so no line. Took sometime for service as he was in back. Got are orders in a timely manner. Now they have no indoor area to sit so that leaves just a couple of benches outside ( no tables ) as many of the other places in town have. If you have little ones I would get it to go. Their ice cream was ok but not worth the drive as I noticed on their signage. Next time I feel like ice cream or custard and need to drive with no place to sit I'll go to my favorite place "luv it custard" at LV Blvd and Oakey.

We came here last week for the first time and there was quite a line, we waited patiently with our two dogs and a good 20 mins later got to the window. Well no wonder there was such a wait, the guy took our order one at a time. Made mine, came back to give it to me, and then asked what my girlfriend wanted. I've been to many other walk up ice cream spots (different cities, mind you) and they take your order as a whole. There would also be more than three people working!! Annoying. So whatever. The ice cream was really only okay. I'd rather Coldstone or Smiths brand for that matter. But we come back a few days later on Wednesday for a second try and the line was still so long. We stood in it for 7 minutes and it didn't even move! So we left and went to Coldstone.  I can't imagine what the wait time/lines are going to be like when Summer actually hits. No thank you.

The staff is friendly, quick and awesome. We've been coming here every week, which is good and bad! Honestly, I can't see myself going anywhere else for dessert... Handel's is hands down the best ice cream you will ever eat. They are very generous with their portions and anything you eat, you will love. I absolutely am in love with the blondie sundae. Instead of just plain vanilla, I get it with praline pecan ice cream!
Omg!!! Delicious flavors. Ice cream was delicious, added some extra toppings too. Staff was very nice and patient.

We ordered the banana split and the guy prepared it without wearing gloves which I think is unsanitary since its the same person who is collecting the money and preparing the order. This guy who helped us was very nice but the owner should provide gloves for the employees.

WoW Excellent ice cream. Chocolate chip mint. Rich & Delicious. My new ice cream place. Way better then the more popular place. And a better price too. The scoops are way bigger here too. A single scoop is like 2 scoops. Try it you'll love it. I promise....

This place is great!! 

SO MANY flavors to choose from. Not only that so many different ways to have your ice cream too. It's a bit overwhelming but in a good way! 

This is a walk up place so don't expect to sit anywhere besides the benches. 

They make ice cream from scratch and you can tell from the flavors and textures. It's smooth and not icy like something that's been sitting and refrozen like other places. 

The service is friendly and quick! Don't hesitate to ask for samples because they encourage it! 

I chose the twix parfait and did not regret it. It was quite large and my boyfriend told me I would not finish it. Well he was wrong because I basically inhaled it. Their hot fudge is so good!! Almost as good as nielsens hot fudge. In this case coming in second to that is not a bad thing. 

I can't wait to go back and try more flavors!

First time visiting. I ordered one scoop of the oree-dough. They gave me so much! It had nice big chunks of Oreo in it. I thought it might be like cookies and cream ice cream with cookie dough but it's just Oreo. The presentation was great though. One big scoop with a mini scoop on top. My boyfriend got the malt milk shake and an ice cream sandwich. It was about as big as the palm of my hand and was delicious. I'm not a huge fan of malt so the milkshake was meh in my opinion, but he did order extra malt. He loved it. Might get extra thick next time though. Overall it was great! The place looks nice and clean and the line moves quickly. I would definitely recommend!
Very delicious ice cream. Best Birthday cake ice cream I've had. Very friendly people.

Believe it or not, there are some people who live in Vegas that think anything under 80 degrees is freezing. Wink wink! But if there's one thing that's going to get them outside to brave the harshest of frozen desert temperatures in the winter, especially if they're the Yelping type, it's ice cream. 

I don't know much about the history of Handel's, just mainly that they're from Ohio and people all across the country love them. This new location, while possibly different from others I've heard about, is completely walk up service only. It's located in a shopping center on the NE corner of Tropicana & Hualapai. And even with a space size that puts pretty much every ice cream shop in town to shame, there is absolutely no where safe from the elements that is customer accessible. Well, besides their own vehicles of course. With 5+ walk up windows preparing to operate during all business hours, there shouldn't be any problem getting you served up pretty quickly though.

On the menu, you're going to find probably way more options then you'll know what do with. There's hurricanes, sundaes, parfaits, ice cream sandwiches, shakes...the list goes on! And if you just want a good ole fashioned scoop or two, there's about 40 or so different choices between the regular ice cream flavors, sherbets and the monthly special. I'm all for having options, but to be honest, there's almost too much here. It could be just be my indecisiveness kicking in, but it was a bit overwhelming. I will say this though. The 4 scoop sampler is one of the coolest things they offer, and I'd imagine it's got to be pretty popular. It's exactly what I ended up going with, and is a steal at only $4.25.

It took a while but we ended up going with Banana Cream Pie, Buckeye, Chocolate Peanut Butter Brownie and Spouse Like A House (vanilla ice cream with peanut butter ripple and chocolate covered peanut butter pretzels swirled in). Each flavor was spot on with what they described and I'd have a hard time picking out a favorite of the four. The banana had a nice, smooth whipped cream type texture and big chunks of banana. The Buckeye had plenty of whole candies in it, which are basically like a big Rolo, but with peanut butter inside. And both the Chocolate Peanut Butter Brownie and Spouse Like A House had plenty of peanut butter flavor without having that terrible frozen peanut butter texture. All were a tad on the sweet side, but very creamy and delicious. The only thing I didn't like is that they all started to melt pretty quick, even in the January winter weather. I imagine during the summer, it'll be tough to finish before you have sugar soup.

For being all window ordering, the service is very friendly. Each employee we talked to was very friendly and seemed to be quite knowledgeable about the products. With our visit being on the first day open, I think that's pretty impressive. Adding that to good quality products at great prices, I'll definitely be returning to Handel's!

BAZILLION FLAVORS O_O

I could decide where to start... literally there are so many things to choose from... they serve everything out of a window which reminds me of the snack shops along the beaches back home. 

There were 2 workers working there when we came... they seemed young.. the guy that took care of us could not remember our scoops so he had to keep coming back to the window... we ordered the 4 scoop sampler which is just scooped into one clear Togo container. Definitely thought that there would be some dividers or something. 

PINK CHAMPAGNE SHERBERT - light & also had a pretty color aahahaha 

ORANGE SHERBERT - not my choice... but it was still OK 

SPOUSE LIKE A HOUSE - thanks to Jin N. Review we got this for the big brother & he liked it w/ the chocolate 

COFFEE CHOCO CHIP - My choice & it was good definitely had a whole bunch of chocolate chips in them which gave the coffee a more espresso flavor 

STRAWBERRY CHEESECAKE - Could use more if the cheesecake flavor

STRAWBERRY x2 - Cant go wrong w/ strawberry

CHOCOLATE - Chocolate is chocolate

Will definitely have to come back to try some other stuff... but two of the 4 sampler scoops came out to be about close to $10

I was born and raised in Youngstown Ohio so this icecream was a staple for all occasions. I grew up eating it and I'm so happy that it made its way to Vegas. Buckeye and graham central station are a must!!!! You will not be disappointed. If you're a pumpkin lover like me their pumpkin cheesecake, pecan and ripple are to die for. They only have these during the autumn season. 

I really don't understand why everyone is complaining about the lack of seating? I don't understand how you could give this place less than five stars. I guess it is a west coast thing to want to sit down while eating icecream. Back home you stand, chat with your friends, sit on the trunk of your car and enjoy your sweet treat. People find anything to complain about. Vegas has large chain restaurants and lacks the "mom and pop" shops that you can taste the love in whatever they serve. 

Handels is authentic, affordable and never disappoints! To those of you people who disagree go back to eating your overpriced, boring DQ or Baskin Robbins crap and save the good stuff for us real icecream lovers!
Two dollar Tuesday's is what it's all about! All their flavors are to die for! You must check this place out if you haven't already. Service is always friendly and fast too!

The ice cream is amazing but the service absolutely sucked!!! Natalie served us and I don't normally call someone out but she was extremely rude. Ask for one sample and then when I asked for a second for my wife she told me this is the last sample and we needed to pick one. Pretty nice person huh??? Sorry but we never heard what an ELVIS ice cream is! She was pretty rude though out the translation! Step it up Natalie!!
Love this place !! I tried the 4 scoop sample.. You cannot go wrong with any type of ice cream you choose.

I'm giving them a 5 star because I love love love the ice cream. I'm from Ohio and I used to go here all the time. However, my review is on the staff. I waited in line forever and then when I finally ordered, everything was all messed up (I literally ordered a small cone and a scoop of vanilla ice cream for my dog). I gave her my card to pay and she didn't tell me how much it was nor did she give me a receipt. I know they have young kids working there but still..

The BEST ice cream in Las Vegas!!! Lots of flavors and every one we've had so far have been delicious and reasonably priced! The four scoop sampler is great for trying new flavors! We love this place and they are all really nice there, give them a try you'll be hooked!!!!
Good selection, delicious flavors. Quite pricey though. Would come back if I was in the area not worth the drive from the other side of town though

This is an awesome new find for me. Such a cute walk-up ice cream place and their staff is always upbeat and generous when you ask to try some of their flavors. They're reasonably priced and their ice cream is one of the best I've had!
We go here almost every Friday. Best ice cream in town. Love all the selections. My favorites are Elvis, New York strawberry cheesecake and Graham central.
Always a good place to stop by and  grab some ice cream. I recommend the orange sherbert parfait.

It may be just a stand but they have wonderful icecream its the best in Vegas so far and I've eaten a lot of places that also had five stars but this is a true five stars even better than most gelato places. And not to mention my favorite part is the staff. If they come in a flavor I'm buying it!

The best ice cream I have ever eaten. I've been coming here now for a few weeks thanks to some friends and I regret not coming sooner. I'm actually not really suppose to eat ice cream because of some dairy problems but surprisingly enough, this place doesn't cause any issues. Probably because it's REAL and delicious. 
I normally get the graham central station (x4) and my boyfriend gets the 4 scoop sampler with all the cheesecake options. WE LOVE THIS PLACE SO MUCH. Now I will say the lines are a bit ridiculous at times but all the aggravation goes away when you take that first scoop and it melts in your mouth. 
This will now be my go to dessert spot  and I've told all my family and friends. If you've seen this place and haven't stopped by yet, DO IT NOW. Especially for the 2 buck Tuesday's.

I used to go twice a week , after being ignored for almost 2 years and referring people from my work , I got tired of the rude attitude from the owner , but spending 20 dollars a week and the only one standing in line for 15 to 18 mins at a time a finally got tired of waiting .The ice cream is good but the owners attitude is terrible, I stopped going and told my co workers that had the same experience with the owner.....I actually gave him another chance not going for 2 years you figure he would say ( where have you been )? But no he made me wait again for 12 min and I was the only one in line ..... terrible service IM DONE with this place !

Delicious! Ice cream is not even one of my favorite desserts but Handel's is in a class by itself!  Completely worth the 20 min drive for me.  Coconut cream pie is amazing.  Have also tried the chocolate cake batter (very good and super rich) buckeye (vanilla with peanut butter/chocolate, yummy!) and graham central station(I didn't think a graham cracker centered flavor could actually be so tasty!).  
Service was super slow and the girl did get one of my sampler flavors wrong but I am sure it is just because they just opened.

Unless you grew up in the midwest you probably haven't heard of this chain. It was new to me and I was pleasantly surprised to see a wide variety of flavors that are unique when compared to most other ice cream chains. A large menu next to the walk-up-and order windows lists all the flavors and specialty items available. It can get busy so you'll have plenty of time to decide what you want. Portion sizes are generous, with a "single scoop" actually consisting of three small scoops of ice cream. The product itself is pretty good. There are plenty of chocolate truffles in the chocolate raspberry truffle flavor, the New York style cheesecake ice cream was also full of cheesecake chunks, and malt balls and bits of graham crackers dotted the Graham Central Station ice cream. All were creamy and somewhat airy, but with a sugary and grainy finish. With summer just around the corner there's no doubt the lines will get even longer.

3.5 Stars
