We moved to this side of town 3 months ago and I'm almost embarrassed of how many times we have visited this place! I haven't tried a flavor I didn't like. My favorite is Graham Central Station and a close second is Buckeye. All of the ice cream is made fresh and is amazingly delicious!

My first visit since I'm not usually in this part of town but I totally get the hype. Way better than B&R in cost and taste! I'll be back! Oh and definitely try the black cherry ice cream, it's a flavor explosion in your mouth!

I absolutely love Handel's! I always come with my friends! I have been here 3 times already and the quality is consistent. I love the four scoop sampler because it is cheap and gives me a variety. The birthday cake flavor is rich and tastes exactly like it's supposed to. The cookies and cream has Oreos inside and you can definitely taste the flavors. My favorite is the cotton candy because they perfectly capture it in an ice cream. The strawberry cheesecake is also delectable because there are little cheesecake bites within it!

Oh my gosh, this place is a true gem! It was hot so I Yelped "ice cream" and Handel's was one of the closest spots with the best reviews. There is no inside seating area at all, this is more of the walk up and go kind of place. I definitely enjoyed their ice cream selection but was a little bummed when I didn't see rocky road on the menu...it's one of my faves. I chose the four scoop sample! Anything with cookies is a winner. Their mango sorbet is PHENOMENAL!!

The ice cream was great, the service was sub-par. 

I pulled this place up on Yelp before heading over and didn't realize, even after reading others reviews that this place has no actual store front so keep that in mind. It is walk up window service ONLY. That wasn't too big of a deal but might take some reconsideration in the summer time on hot days or for those who have a car full of kids. 

Handel's has an extensive menu full of fun names and sweet flavors of creamy goodness. I didn't want to be one of those people that didn't know what I wanted, but I guess I was. I asked a total of three questions and was given short agitated answers by the man behind the window. I'm sorry I don't know what cookies or candies are inside your ice cream flavors sir. The man was impatient and seemed rushed to get me away from his window. I quickly ordered a cone with graham central station and paid in cash. I was at the window a total of two minutes...no one was behind or in front of me. 

The ice cream was delicious with swirls of graham cracker and chocolate and a nice healthy service for less than $4 but I don't feel welcome enough to come back and worry that not having an actual store might hinder customers with small children who want to pick a "color" or need a place to sit while eating their cones. That is something to keep in mind.

"Taste Of Ohio In The Desert"

ATMOSPHERE:

Handel's Ice Cream from Ohio is the latest frozen treat spot to open on the Southwest side of town. Walk up windows are your only choice here, and it's standing room only like we did,  in the evening, and while it was in the 40's. Just like Luv-It Frozen Custard, your car is your dining area...

BITES:

A wide variety of flavors to choose from, sundaes, shakes, splits, pints, you name it, they got it! I went with the Four Scoop Sampler ($4.25) so I could try four of their 25+ flavors offered. My choices were Banana Cream Pie, Blueberry Cobbler, Salted Caramel Truffle, and Spouse Like A House which is malted vanilla ice cream with chocolate covered peanut butter filled pretzel pieces. I enjoyed the Banana Cream Pie and Spouse Like A House, but my other two flavors were a bit too sweet for my tastes. I also got a bite of Wifey's Cherry Cordial Sundae, and that too was very sweet! overall, just okay for me, but I can at least say I've tried Handel's.

CLOSING STATEMENTS:

Variety, flavor options, and price point may catch people's attention, but be warned that there's no dining area, only your car, and some of the flavors tend to be excessively sweet which may not be such a good idea if you have kids. They'll definitely be bouncing off the walls!  ALOHA!!!

Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  3

Will I return?  Not likely....I'll just stick to what I know and like...

Taco Tuesdays? Love em...but Handels low-key has the one of the sweetest (pun intended) Tuesday deals in the city. How can you not love  $2 Tuesday one nice hearty scoop of a their delicious creamy ice cream flavors after work. I love to go and try different flavors, I recommend the pineapple sherbet and pistachio, always satisfy my sugar cravings.
 I like the simplicity of Handels you go up to their window... ask and go, there is out door seating if you wanna get to business right then and there. I kinda wish they had some indoor seating only because I do like to eat ice cream year round, but I'll manage. The staff is always friendly and I've never seen anybody leave with the look of unsatisfaction. 
Definitely a top ice cream spot here in Vegas, good flavors, can be a bit pricey if you don't go on Tuesdays, but worth treating yourself to some quality ice cream every now and then!

We love this place. So many hand made ice cream flavor to choose from. Ever Tuesday is $2 Tuesday. It's a great way for me to show my son appreciation for all of his hard work at school. If you don't like this place then you probably won't like anything :-)

Graham Central Station is hands down the best ice cream I've ever had. Never been a huge fan of ice cream and dairy products in general but I could eat my weight of GCS. Huge chunks of graham cracker with chocolate-covered I-don't-even-know-whats.
Be forewarned. A waffle cone "single" scoop is more like a single, shovel scoop. It's huge. We have to eat in our car during the summer months; otherwise, it melts and drips faster than I can gobble it down.
Their other flavors are really good too but I've now synonymized "Handels" with GCS. They'll let you try any flavor you want but try to save GCS for last so you can at least consider the other flavors before dedicating your life to GCS.

Definitely one of my favorite ice cream shops! Every time we've gone the employees are always very helpful and pleasant! My family loves to go and get some creamy yummy goodness on a hot summer night! Love this place!

I usually come in the summer to get some Handel's. The ice cream here is definitely worth the splurge especially on 2 buck Tuesday.  

What I wasn't so happy about was the customer service that I had.  We went up to a line on the side where a family was being serviced. We already stood and waited behind them for 3 minutes. The girl left to do something and I assumed she would be back. There wasn't a sign to say the counter was closed or anything so I waited another 5-7 minutes before someone finally opened the window to ask if we needed something even though I made eye contact with at least 2 people during my entire wait.  After someone finally opened the window, the person told me I had to go around to a different window.  No one could've taken 10 seconds to tell me to go around before that???  I waited another 10 minutes in the other line. When I finally got up to the counter, they opened the same window that I had waited for before literally 3 minutes after they told me to go around with the same girl at the counter! I was definitely unhappy with today's service.

Literally the best ice cream I have ever eaten. Got the strawberry cheesecake chunk- definitely did not regret it. Real strawberries and real cheesecake (not the fake frozen chunks they serve at froyo places). So freaking good. Will return (probably more times than I should)!

I'm not sure about the fuss. I was in the mood for some gelato or ice-cream and Handel's had 4 stars on Yelp. It's a definite local spot. There's no inside area, so you just order at the window and I ended up eating in the car. I got 2 flavors to try it out, pistachio and Elvis (banana and peanut butter). I always get a nut flavor if they have it. The pistachio didn't have a lot of pistachio flavor even though it had tons of nuts in the ice cream. The Elvis was actually really good, the combo of banana ice cream with peanut butter. It wasn't as awesome as I expected with the great reviews. The serving was huge and the price was cheap, a little over $4 for 2 scoops.

The most amazing ice cream EVER!!!!

I grew up outside of Youngstown, OH where the company originated from.  Moving out to Las Vegas made me miss the best of the best from back east.  But long behold, Handel's is finally here!  The ice cream is dead on from Ohio.  So many flavors to try but I can never get past by favorites!  Try the malted chocolate peanut butter or the salted caramel truffle.  You may want to pass up the scoop and opt for a quart because it is that good.  

Staff is super friendly and the owner is totally awesome!   Keep up the great work Handel's.  I'll see you real soon!

Decent ice cream.  Good selection of flavors and generous with the mix ins.   Lines can get long and sometimes they seem understaffed with only one window open.  The guy I think is the owner/manager could use a refresher on his customer service skills.  Can be pretty short with customers.  I go there when bored with Ben & Jerry's flavors.

This is basically an ice cream stand in a strip mall.  They have a million flavors and it's hard to decide which is my favorite.  There are a few benches outside for seating but nothing inside.  You order at the window and stay outside. Ice cream was good and from what I gather from my Ohio people, it's a staple back there.

If you have ever liked cheesecake in your life (I've never been a huge fan until I came here) you will fall in love with their cheesecake ice cream!! I literally need to get it every week because it is that good. Their buckeye and apple pie are also really tasty among the other 50 flavors they offer here. The staff are always super friendly and helpful. Come for their $2 Tuesday cup deal if you're in a budget. I love this place.

Truly exceptional ice cream!

This place has fresh ice cream and wonderful staff. The Buckeye ice cream is an Ohio classic and highlights the store's roots. The caramel pretzel crunch is fantastic.

You order from the outside windows which is fun in itself. Welcome to town Handel's!

Ice cream is good but not worth the wait. Everytime my husband and I go, there is a line of about ten people and one maybe two employees working. This evening sealed the deal that we will not be going back. This is the third time we stepped out of line to grab ice cream elsewhere. This makes me sad only because I worked at the one in Ohio when I was in high school. On summer nights we had every window open with limited line waits. Customer service is something this location may want to think about improving. Gotta spend the money to make the money.

We go to Handel's a lot for their amazing ice cream. However this past visit, we felt that the service was appalling. We went for Father's Day because my husband wanted one of the amazing monster milkshakes. He ordered and I ordered a cone with 2 flavors. The server said that I would have to order a double which is 4 1/2 scoops of ice cream if I wanted two flavors. A single is 2 1/2 scoops. He insisted that he could not do 1 scoop of one flavor and 1 1/2 scoops of another. Which seems crazy to me. And I know they have done it before. Then my friends ordered and paid the whole bill. After they paid they saw that we were double charged the milkshake and my cone. When we brought it to their attention, the server was curt and handed her $6.50, the cost of the milkshake. My friend pointed out that she was still owed for the cone and tax. So the manager came over and was just as curt. He finally gave her the cash back and then slammed the window shut. I was shocked. It is too bad because every other time the women who served us were friendly and accommodating. These two gentlemen, the server and manager, need to up their game.

This place is dangerous... They make such good creamy ice cream. When I moved away from Henderson, I was so sad to move away from Mr. D's frozen custard. But thank goodness Handel's opened up AND it's ice cream!!! There are 35 flavors, and that's just the ice cream. The employees are super friendly, greeting us with a smile each time. We tried pints of the yelp favorite flavors: spouse like a house, banana cream pie, and salted caramel truffle. But one that I don't think gets enough recognition is Graham Central Station. If you like the taste of graham crackers, you'll Love this one!!! One pint is never enough! Will for sure go back at least 31 more times and hopefully try each ice cream flavor!!

Just came across this place randomly and really glad I did, this place has some of the best hidden Ice cream in Las Vegas, a must go if you are out by the area. I will be coming back and the prices are really reasonable

I don't know how anyone could not like this place. So many flavors!!
These ice creams are so thick, rich, and creamy. I usually stay away from dairy but it's pretty impossible to resist dipping in for another bite after you've started.

My sister and I shared a 4 flavor sampler($4.25).

Flavors chosen:
Coconut cream pie
Banana cream pie
Blueberry crumble
Raspberry cheesecake -My favorite out of the four!

Price is right, service is great. I can see the wait being a bit frustrating in the summer when it gets busy. They have multiple windows to order from but with so many flavors to try and choose from, making a decision might take a while. I hope that they decide to add some outdoor seating soon.
Awesome flavors Galore!!!!! So many yummy treats to choose from! It's my favorite ice cream place in Nevada & honestly the only ice cream place I keep going back to. Everything else falls short.

Amazing homemade chocolate pecan ice Cream. This is the real deal creamy, fresh ingredients.  Icecream...like nothing you have ever tasted!  The Buckeye's do it again.....welcome Handel's to Las Vegas!

This was my first time going to this business. I am a huge fan of cheesecake ice cream and theirs is spot on. It has chunks in the ice cream not just flavoring. The location is easy to find and it's very well priced for the quality. Great place for ice cream
Great dessert, but the guy working was a little rude. I felt like he was going to get in trouble if he kept the window open to talk to us.
Best best best handmade ice cream. If you haven't been here, your true my missing out. So many flavors to choose from and can purchase punts and quarts as well.

Best ice cream? ......No, there are other choices in the Las Vegas area that are just as good.

But customer service is terrible and MAYBE not because of the server's fault.  It's the store policy!

My daughter, her friend, and I went into the store to buy ice cream cones.  The server takes our order and hands the cone to my daughter and her friend.  Well, the scoop of ice cream falls out of the cone and onto the floor.  We made it a point to tell the server the ice cream just fell right out without tipping the cone.  He replied the rehearsed line, "it's our policy not to replace the ice cream.".....REALLY?.....  And this after you didn't smush it down into the cone hard enough so it could stay put or that the little girl didn't tip the cone over? (she's 9)  So I had to shell out another $3.75 to replace the cone.

I think the goodwill shown by replacing the ice cream scoop for free is better than having to charge the customer more money for something that wasn't even the girl's fault.  I don't fault the server  (he's following orders from the owners) but taking good care of your customers is worth a lot more than an extra $3.75. You can always make an exception, especially when it's a young child. How can you tell a child who drops their ice cream ( clean drop, no licks yet) that they can't have a replacement?

This is a walk up window with benches outside which we didn't know before going but didn't bother us at all. All of their ice cream is homemade and they have tons of flavors, and not just your typical kinds. I would recommend getting the 4 scoop sampler so you can try a few, plus it's only  $4.25. The graham cracker, oreo cookie dough, strawberry cheesecake, blueberry cobbler, salted caramel truffle, peanut butter brownie, cinnamon roll were all delicious, some of the best ice cream we have ever had! The only one we didn't care for was the pumpkin pecan but that's just cause it was a little too pumpkiny which is probably more of a personal preference thing then a fault of the ice cream itself. I highly recommend and we will be going back.
Best ice cream hands down! $2 scoop tuesdays is the way to go. Creamy and so good! I got the peanut butter and chocolate and hubs got the dairy free in watermelon. Great price too!

I've been wanting to try this place for a while now.  Finally decided to go with my son this past Saturday.  When we arrived I noticed that it's a walk-up window only.  Not a problem since we were not going to eat there anyway.  They have a good size menu with lots of flavors and cookie sandwiches.  My son decided on the latter and I opted for two scoops on a waffle cone.  I proceeded to order when the girl tells me that I cannot get two scoops of two different flavors.  She stated they go by serving size.  I stood there with a confused look on my face.  Okay, so I cannot get two scoops with two different flavors? Isn't a scoop a serving size?  I'm confused.  She said no, then went on to explain their serving size.  Again I was a little confused.  Whether it be scoops or serving size, she made it seem as if I could not get two different ones on a cone.  Her explanation was a little weird to me, thus leaving a sour taste in my mouth. Especially after looking over to the gentleman next to me, walking away with two different scoops on a regular cone.  By the time I received my waffle cone with only one flavor I was annoyed and did not enjoy my it at all.  I felt like I could have went to Sweet Addiction for Thrifty's Ice Cream (some of the best in my opinion) or Baskin Robbins and been satisfied.  

Now that it's been a few days since my visit I feel like I can give a good review without being annoyed as I was initially.  Will I go back? No. Was the ice cream good? Honestly it was just alright.  I was very underwhelmed.

My continuing mission to discover nondairy ice creams (Ice dessert) in Las Vegas has  brought me to Handel's. The mission is also to pursue those icy sweet indulgences while preserving my fragile digestive system. This time, mission was a success. 

Handel's has three nondairy options: 1) Coconut, 2) Watermelon Ice, and 3) Mango. They are all distinctly fantastic. Three options may seem measly, but this is the most I've seen in a ice cream shop thus far.  

Coconut is my favorite fruit; messing it up would have instantly made the mission a presumptive failure. Luckily, Handel's coconut ice "cream" blew me out of the water. The coconut was not overpoweringly sweet--something I value highly. The coconut flavor was subtle just like a real coconut. More impressive was the soft coconut flesh hidden in the ice cream, they added some welcoming texture which also retained the flavor a bit longer in the mouth once the cream portion happily melts away. Needlessly to say, Handle's coconut ice cream was a resounding victory. 

The Watermelon Ice flavor was equally impressive. As the name suggests, this is just ice with presumably watermelon juice. The lack of creamy taste is a refreshing contrast to the coconut. Again, no overpowering sugar taste here, each spoonful filled with potent watermelon flavor. The texture is soft but does not have that sandy texture most shaved ice have. It almost feels like crushed watermelon flesh. Pretty cool. 

I only had a little bit of the mango because I am just not a big fan of the fruit. However, I will not be hesitant to recommend the mango flavor to those who love mango--It had the same great attributes the coconut flavor had.

My mission to discover nondairy ice desserts continues on, but it could have ended with Handel's. If you miss out on ice cream because of dairy, Handle's got you covered.

I usually dont give reviews but this has definitely been a lousy experience. Ice cream was mediocre and service is horrible. I understand they have a lot of customers everytime i pass by. But today happens to be one of those days wherein there was only two of us in line. Employee was rude and impatient, rushing me so i can finish my order. This was my FIRST time, it's not like i can memorize the names of ice cream flavors available and the flavor options were located in the middle so had to keep on going back and forth to give ____ my order. Seriously if you have issues pls dont bring it to work. Really disappointed.

Hands down one of the best ice cream place in Vegas! Been going here for a year and I just LOVE everything I've gotten. I usually do the single scoop or 4 scoop sampler. It's so rich and creamy. Fave flavors are coffee chip, salted caramel, and buckeye...well everything is pretty good. There's no chairs/tables though so u pretty much eat it outside or take it to go. I wish they would eventually provide tables and chairs outside. Overall, I love the ice cream and most of the employees are pretty nice.

A group of us stopped here for our final stop of a long day of hiking, volunteering, eating, and Handel's was the finish line.

I went with the four flavor sampler which I was assured was a good way of tasting different varieties at a value price of $4.25.  I got the chocolate raspberry truffle, salted caramel truffle, spouse like a house, and buckeye.  My least favorite was the chocolate raspberry truffle and I liked the salted caramel truffle the most.

It's difficult picking flavors when you have no idea what they are based on some made up fun names.  It would be like ordering sushi rolls based on the names those places give if there was no listing after to explain the ingredients.  That would have been my problem had I gone by myself and didn't have friends who had already been there to ask questions and get their advice.

The ice cream is OK and it is creamy but I don't think there's anything special to it.  While this is fairly close to home, I could think of a couple of places I'd go for more exotic and creative flavors.  Since this is close to home, I'[m sure I'll be stopping here again but it won't be my go to place.

This has got to be one of, if not, the best dessert spots in town. Rich, delicious, homemade ice cream, in both  classic and non - traditional flavors. You're always safe with anything chocolate in my book, but I always catch myself leaning towards an addition of a scoop of coconut cream pie or banana cream pie too.  The walk up will always have a line but well worth the wait. Pricing is very reasonable for what you get and the staff are all attentive and friendly. If you haven't been here yet do yourself a favor; write it down, take a picture, or better yet, just get your a$$ down to Handel's.

Creamy, but not overly sweet...I am glad that I made the drive out here to try this place. I got the 4 flavor sampler and my favorite was the Oree-dough, although the others were good too (graham station, salty caramel, and cherry vanilla). My boyfriend got praline pecan and I forget the other flavor...the only one I tasted was the praline, and it was delicious! He really liked his, and is sort of an ice cream fan of sorts...so if he liked it, it has to be good.

3 1/2 stars. Exciting addition to the neighborhood. 

We biked over to earn our ice cream. There are no tables so we had to sit on the cement; hopefully, they'll rectify this. 

I felt perplexed when I read other reviews saying the ice cream was too sweet. Then, I tried it. It is, indeed, very very sweet. I ordered the caramel pretzel crunch but I got the salty Carmel truffle. No biggie but a mix up nonetheless. 

They are very nice but certainly not speedy if you're in a hurry. I've already seen a line in January! Good for them. About 40 flavors to try so we will certainly have to go again. A neighbor recommended trying something more inherently bitter like a dark chocolate to cut the sweetness. Sage advice for the next visit. 

My little one got the birthday cake. It had chunks of fondant in it. Holy moly - this could put you into a diabetic coma in seconds. Sooooo unbelievably sugary. He liked it, of course. 

I'm sure it'll be crazy in the summer!

My in-law family is from Ohio. This is a taste of home for them and I now absolutely LOVE this place. Never again will I go to a chain ice cream shop. 
Our top (and only) 3 picks are Buckeye, Gram Central Station, & Banana Cream Pie.

The best ice cream in Vegas. There is no indoor seating but they have a few benches outside. The ice cream is fresh and delicious. The serve real fruit in their ice cream which is a plus. Will be going back again.
Three words....OFF THE HOOK! I do wish they had smaller sizes. Such a great selection and it's all delicious.

I've only tried 3 or 4 flavors so far, but we have been coming here frequently! Everything tastes great!

$2 Tuesdays!

This is an awesome place to take the kids!

When Im asked, what would you last meal on earth be? I respond with whatever restaurant Im feeling, and ice cream from Handels. Im thankful its 60 miles from my home, or I would become  a spouse like a house (one of their cleverly named flavors!). 

I flip out over the flavors they come up with, yesterday I tried pumpkin pecan, and cinnamon roll. Both divine. My go to, banana cream pie, chocolate cake batter, often times they have blueberry cobbler which is amazing, and sometimes I go with a seasonal. This ice cream is, hands down, the best ice cream I have ever eaten.

Note, I just saw a sign that they now have lactose free ice cream made with almond milk!!

This is the spot!!!! Hands down best ice cream in the city !!!! This is the only thing that keeps you from missing blue bell!!!! I love this place and they make the ice cream by hand. It's a little pricey compared to some spots but it's definitely worth it. If your family is big you gotta go in Tuesday's $2 special is always good!!!!!

I enjoy great ice cream and this place didn't disappoint. It was a hot day in Las Vegas so I stopped in after lunch.

Went with the waffle cone with black cherry and strawberry ice cream which was yummy and generous in portion. They don't have any indoor seating, but they do have a few benches you can kick back at.

Overall, totally yummy ice cream and a good place for satisfying my sweet tooth!

We were extremely satisfied with the very generous 1 scoops of homemade ice cream in waffle cones! Worth the visit! New tradition for us while in Vegas!!! Website said they don't skimp...they don't lie!

Homemade ice cream heaven!!!!!!  Get ready to die from the massive flavor selection. Every single scoop of this creamy treat will create an ice cream addiction that you will not be able to break. Nothing else in town can compare. You'll have to move to another city to get away from this ice cream crack stand. This is not an ice cream joint for the bullshitter. Serious ice cream consumers only! The calories will kill you, but the trip to homemade ice cream heaven is worth every bite.

It's in the smiths parking lot ! Back
Corner ! You order by the walk up window. Customer service is awesome! All very friendly. I came here on a Tuesday and it was 2 bucks Tuesday ! Such a great deal. Ice cream was delicious. I got the ny cheesecake and my bf got the graham station.

You can't go wrong here. There are a ton of choices and a scoop is pretty big it's a tough decision. They are very helpful with letting you taste anything you want. I did the blueberry cobbler and black cherry delicious!! Next time I'm going for the coffee chip my friend got it and it was amazing!!

This has by far been the best ice cream joint I've visited here in Las Vegas. The ice cream was delicious, creamy, and had awesome flavors. -1 star though for the service, the young man that helped my girlfriend and I was such a Debbie downer, and so was the girl helping the gentleman next to us. It wouldn't hurt to smile guys!
Great ice cream at decent prices. Love the set up and ordering windows remind me of my childhood growing up.

I didn't review this place before??? How?!?! May be I wanted to keep this gem all to myself... With the product Handel's offers, it would be quite impossible. The icecream here is spectacular! Soooo many flavors, sooo creamy, sooo chunky, flavors are sooo well pronounced!
Let me just say, I love chunky icecream! I love when it has chunks of what ever deliciousness I desire mixed in it. Handel's does just that. Not all flavors are chunky but ofcourse the ones I loved are :)
My faves? Blueberry cobbler, banana cream pie, salted caramel with chocolate covered pretzels- sooo magical!!! Another bonus, there's a sampler pack - 4 flavors for $4.25. Amazing deal for high quality ice cream.
So there it goes, cat's out the bag... Handel's is the crack!

Best ice cream in Vegas hands down! I'm originally from the birthplace of Handel's (Youngstown, OH) and got ice cream here after every one of my softball games when I was younger. I was really surprised to see it out here. But very pleased. Tons of different homemade flavors - black cherry, graham central station & chocolate pb brownie are awesome. Give this place a try!!

We've been eyeballing this place out for quite sometime now since we live just around in Town Center. My husband and I were looking for a new close by desert spot and decided to finally try this place out. We came a little pass 9pm last night (Sunday) and there was a short line but nothing crazy. We were excited by the huge selection they had to offer specially when the advertisement said that their ice cream were hand made daily. I decided to get the 4 sampler and my husband wanted a hurricane. The guy who helped us from the left windrow told us they can't make a hurricane anymore. It didn't need to take him to roll his eyes to show that he was being so salty to his customers. Though it looked like he really wanted to. The other guy on the right window was alright by the way. I wasn't sure if this guy was in a bad mood or something. But my husband felt so uncomfortable to the point he finally got so irritated and decided not to get anything for himself anymore. At first there was a lady in front of us that ordered and before she even completely finished ordering, the guy just shut the window on her. I felt bad for the lady because she was so sweet and she felt a little embarrassed about what he did too. Too bad we came in the wrong time as our first time. Maybe well go back again because we like supporting this kind of food joint. Maybe when were not feeling Yogurtland on Flamingo/215, but not anytime soon.

Really good ice cream!
I was just looking for some ice cream on a cone, nothing special and when I got here it was like "wow, look at this menu!". They have a lot of flavors and options to choose from.
And it's really good! I got myself a strawberry cheesecake on a waffle cone, absolutely amazing!!!

It's a little weird of a place with no inside, you order at a window and just leave with your ice cream. There's no sitting down, so if you're thinking of hanging out while enjoying your ice cream, this is not the place. According to the guy, it's old school, like ice cream places used to be back in the day.

The only reason why I'm not giving this place five stars is the service. See, it's not the fact that you can't sit down and enjoy your ice cream peacefully, that didn't bother me as much as the way the guy who served us was acting. So grumpy, not personable at all. 
I felt like we were bothering him by being there to order something.
It's an ice cream for place! Be nice.
There are so many places you can go to to have ice cream (that you can actually sit down), if you're picking that place they should offer you nothing but a good experience.
Smooth and creamy ice cream,  lots of ingredients in the mix and great customer service.  Great ice cream shop!

We all scream for ice cream! This place is on point if you want some quality ice cream! I recommend the banana split! Also, the banana cream pie oh my! So many options to choose from. This place can get very busy so beware of that. Also, this place in similar to sonic in the sense of you don't go inside. 

One bad thing about this place is that there is no order to the lines. It's just a bunch of windows and everybody looking around to see who is next. If they had like dots to stand on or numbers to stand on, that would help.

The line situation is iffy. We waited outside for quite a while and the guy tending our lane just booked when we were next and we stood there confused as to if he was coming back for 10 minutes until someone else helped us. Otherwise, the ice cream is definitely top notch. And I consider myself an ice cream aficionado.

I scream for ice cream!!! 

Loved this joint.  Came here on a Tuesday but i must warn you it is busy because of $2 ice cream on Tuesdays.   Though its busy, I barely waited 10 minutes.  

As you stand in line, I suggest you take a picture of the menu and choose it before they take your order.  It just makes the process much faster.  I got the 4 scoop sampler for $4.25.  Beat that Baskin Robins.  Anyways, it comes in a clear container.  You could also order a side cone or waffle but I just had sushi so I was a bit stuffed.  I chose the blue monster (chips ahoy & oreos), strawberry, watermelon, and pineapple.  So colorful and bomb!! They all had great flavor.  The watermelon and blue monster were my fav.  No seating so we sat in the back of the truck (Hawaii Style).

Being from Youngstown, I was soooo excited to hear that Handel's was coming to Las Vegas. There is NOTHING like this here. DQ, Baskin Robbins...ICK. Ive had to settle for frozen yogurt. When you've had Handel's everything else mine as well be from the freezer section of the grocery store in a carton. 
Its just like home, stand outside and wait in line at a walk up window. I got my usual, a scoop of grape and a scoop of vanilla w oreo. YUMMY!  Had some of Eds butter pecan....OMG so delish. The flavors are the same as Ohio (thank goodness). My reason for 4 stars is because the scoops seemed a lil skimpy compared to Youngstown which was a lil disappointing but my waistline thanks me :)
Vegas....go treat yourself. If you love ice cream, there's NO DOUBT you will fall in love. Unsure what to choose from all the flavors? Just ask for a sample.

This place is so amazing!! Every flavor is so good. The buckeye ice cream is full of tons of little Buckeyes. The coffee ice cream has chocolate chips in it. If you are looking for tons of variety and great ice cream. Try this place!!
The employees are really friendly and helpful. Ice cream it's delicious just wish they had room to stay n eat the ice cream there but I love it.

Get ready to get ice cream wasted because one scoop is going to be what it takes to fill your stomach! The portions are huge it's crazy! Went with my family (7 people) each ordered something different from single scoops to hurricanes to 4 scoop sampler and paid $30 which is great! And we still couldn't finish all of it! There's a huge selection of ice cream nothing too unique but most likely going to find a flavor you at least would want. For the prices and servings it's great. Not sure if I'd return for a particular craving but definitely a good place to experience.
Just wasted 15 minutes outside this place with no one paying attention to the window. Music is on and it's supposed to be open but no one was there.

Growing up in the Midwest means that as a child I got to experience the ice cream flavor that is "Blue Moon". Recently I had a craving for this particular flavor and learned that it really is only common in the Midwest, so the hunt to find it out here was on. I stumbled upon Handel's on Yelp and to my excitement I saw that they had Blue Moon as a constant flavor. I was a little worried going up to the window and seeing a picture of the Blue Moon flavor being listed as "blue raspberry flavored" (because Blue Moon is NOT blue raspberry) but decided to try it out as I went all that way for it specifically. And it was perfect. It was the correct Blue Moon flavor and it was so creamy and delicious. I recommend this flavor completely. I don't know how to describe the taste other than "kind of like fruity pebbles" but trust me, it's awesome. 

I also got to try a bite of the Nutella/chocolate hazelnut flavor (yum) and while eating our ice cream we were already talking about what we'd want to try next time! 

I honestly can't wait to come back and try more ice cream flavors here. I love that this is a local business and I adore that they sell hard packed ice cream, which is so hard to find in the valley. Their pricing is fair for a non-chain hard packed ice cream shop, and it's even cheaper on Tuesdays when they offer single scoops for $2. 

I completely recommend this shop (and their Blue Moon) and I can't wait to go back again.

Gone to this ice cream place twice already and guess when...TUESDAY. Why? $2 buck TUESDAY! 

Handel's gives enough ice cream for you to enjoy. 
I like how there's just a window for you to order and not the typical ice cream businesses. It reminds of the old days. 

We usually order Pistachio or Butter Pecan. Recently we tried their seasonal ice cream called Pumpkin Pecan. The best choice! It was delicious!

Came to Handel's with my sisters and waited 20 minutes for what should've been 5. This is what my milkshake looked like when it came out, then I had to wait additional time until they realized they forgot part of my order. Very disappointing.
The best ice cream!! Such a cute little walk up ice cream shop that's been there forever!! Def a must try if you like ice cream!

I thought by all of the high star ratings that this place has, that this was going to be a great ice cream place. After reviewing the extensive menu, I decided to try a brownie hurricane. There was not anyone else waiting, and it seemed to take a while to prepare. What I received was a cup of melted ice cream with some brownies in it. It was very unappealing, I've had milkshakes thicker than this. On top of that it $5 for this melted ice cream, don't think I'll ever be going back.

The first time we ever had Handels was when my family and I were just wandering around Redondo beach on vacation. There was a line for it so we tried it out and loved it! We recently moved to the southwest area, near Bishop Gorman and were so surprised that Handels was here near us! Best ICE CREAM spot! My favorite is their banana creme pie flavor! They've got a lot of flavors and every Tuesday is $2 TUESDAYS!

I have not been here in a long time since I'm avoiding sweets. But today was so hot that I had to stop by on my way home, instead of having coffee. 

Don't expect a fancy ice cream shop, this place is just a window you order from. They have a variety of flavors and some daily specials. I always get the four (4) scoop sampler, as I can't decide on what flavor all the time. The price is unbelievable for $4.60 out the window (get my drift). You can also get pints to take home, banana split, sundaes and ice pops.

They only have two (2) windows to order from and service is good.

This place has some really yummy stuff. I couldn't help but indulge in my daughters, my friends & my own ice cream. It's the in we fatty screaming at me saying 'Do it for Yelp!' So yeah I took one for the team. The blue raspberry my daughter enjoyed in a baby cone, which was the cutest thing. My friend James has a strawberry cheesecake & that was like heaven in a cup! Mine, because I'm lactose intolerant & Dani, the sweet gal runnin the show, informed me they had vegan options. They have coconut milk & almond milk ice cream!! How cool is that! I totally got a quart because I finished the pint I just bought from Whole Foods! 

On Tuesday's they have $2 Two Scoop Tuesday's. Super neat way to cool down on a budget. 

Totally coming back to see Dani's smiling face & hear more recommendations!

Best ice cream in Las Vegas. Do not have indoor seating but there are a few benches around. Always a line. Chocolate marshmallow is the best!  Can also get 4 scoop sampler to try a few different flavors. Well worth the trip. No bathrooms available in the area, Have to go to Smiths market

Such a cute, old school type of ice cream shop! They have a ton of flavors & I love that they do a 4 scoop deal for only $4.25. Great & cost effective way to see what flavors you like. My favorites were the mocha almond & the salted caramel. Some flavors were just okay, like the blue raspberry but overall the flavors were good. 

Don't come here if you're looking to eat inside because it's an outside, walk up & order type of deal. They do have some benches outside though. The only downfall to me was their baked goods. I got a blondie & it barely had any flavor to it. I'd say get the ice cream & skip out on any of their baked goods.

My favorite ice cream ever!!!! 
The only problem is that it's addicting lol Can't get enough of it. 
They also have ice cream for dogs, which my dog totally loves!! 
On Christmas time they have a flavor called "peppermint stick": You have to try it!!

Went here twice in one week! I lived in Ohio for four years before moving to Las Vegas and never tried this place out! On my first visit I tried the four scoop sampler with Bananas Foster, Blueberry Cobbler, Graham Central Station and Blue Moon. They were all delicious but Graham Central Station was my absolute favorite. It's unique and you can taste the graham crackers/cinnamon as well as the fun toffee texture and crunch. Blueberry cobbler is always delicious with a creamy texture pairing well with sweet blueberry flavor. Blue Moon is hard to find anywhere else in Vegas and is a nice raspberry flavor in a vibrant blue for the summer though not my cup of tea. I could taste the rum in the Bananas Foster which was tasty but not my personal fave. During my second visit I tried the banana cream pie... every bite tasted of real banana as well as the perfect amount of pie crust. It's hard to pick a favorite but for now I'd say Graham Central Station and Banana Cream Pie are tied. I'll have to come back to discover more favorites and expand my ice cream palate!!

This place brings me back to my childhood- ice cream of all interesting flavors served out of a window ! On the east coast it is very common to find a little ice cream stand on the corner serving amazing ice cream! I had the black raspberry and it was so good! Def going back this summer !

Went the first week it opened and was disappointed especially since my reference knows my love for ice cream. Scoops were pathetic but today I ordered 2 pints, apple pie and blueberry cobbler. Still haven't tried the $2 scoop Tuesday but the pints were far worth another try. DEFINITELY WILL RETURN.

Banana Cream Pie on two buck Tuesdays. You're welcome.

I really should end it there. 

Blueberry cobbler was too sweet. Mint chip was alright. Graham Central Station was amazing. 

Good thing I don't live here anymore. I'd stop by way too often!

Omg in love! I love that Vegas has a place like this. It reminds me something you would see in a smaller town and back on the East coast. I love little ice cream places like this.

The best deal is the four scoop sampler. You get four scoops of ice cream for $4.25! What a steal.

I got this and tried chocolate chip cookie dough, pistachio, chocolate peanut butter and another peanut butter flavor but the name escapes me! (oops :) ) 

I loved the pistachio-one of my favorite flavors for sure.

There is no inside to this place so be prepared to wait outside. It also can be very busy-I waited over a half hour last time I was there. It would be nice if they were better staffed to accommodate the large crowds because last time they only had two people working.

Errrrr merrrrr gerrrrrd. Yes. The banana cream pie and blueberry cobbler are outstanding. I wish their menu was a little easier to read/in a different spot, there's always so many people there they kind of block it. Glad I don't live too far from this place!
Had a milkshake. Pretty good, 4/5. The regular size is huge. They need bigger straws though, hard to drink the milkshake with the small straws.

We love Handels so much! Every flavor we have tried has been delicious! If you're overwhelmed with the amount of choices they let you sample them! My favorite is the New York cheesecake! We let everyone know about handels and bring everyone with us! If you're weary you should try it on Tuesdays for their $2 scoops! So so good, we'll probably go tonight for date night ;)

Not very happy.. I really should have got my $8.00 back for the worst banana split ever!!! Who dosn't put hot fudge or chocolate or Pineapple or strawberry or somthing??? On a split... ice cream nuts cool whip was it... had to ask for a cherry and sprinkles because my 4 year old was so disappointed. .. ice cream was fair not worth $8.00?? They need better customer service. They need to clarify a banana split comes striped

***YELP 100 CHALLENGE 16/100***

It's nice to see so many people are excited for this new addition in the SW community. A personal recommendation from our son's teacher was our nudge to try this place. The excitement was quite contagious as you see natives of Youngstown abuzz and reminisce their childhood days eating this ice cream. They have an interesting lay out as there isn't any tables, chairs or benches to sit on, just a walk up window to order, which I think would be challenging during summer time when people just wanna hang out and relieve themselves from the unforgiving Vegas heat. 

We got the Banana split for the hubby; Blueberry crumble, Buckeye and Salted caramel truffle single scoops at $3.50 each which in retrospect, had I paid attention or a suggestion from the lady helping us, we should've gotten the sampler instead which would have been a better value at $4.25 for 4 scoops. The flavors I tried seemed to be on the sweeter side which was a little too much for me. Quality is ok and would like to try more flavors but not in a hurry to come back.

Straight from Ohio!! Homemade ice cream with chunks of fresh fruit in their pineapple & strawberry flavors. Get the sample...4 scoops for $4.50 Best Value! A flavor for everyone's liking. You won't be disappointed.

When I tell you this is The BEST homemade ice cream  I am not lying l!! They have over 25 different flavors. The brownie sundae and Apple pie a la mode is deeeeelicious!!!  And every Tuesday is $2 for a single scoop but it's so huge it's like a double!! Go here NOW!!!!

Old fashioned freshly made ice cream with so much of a plethora of flavors that you seem like (figuratively) a kid in an ice cream store (figuratively too because you order from a window and they get it for you). The flavors are amazing and the ice cream is made fresh in the store EVERYDAY. That shows why they get as much business as they do. I have always seen lines waiting to order.

Tried Handel's for their $2 Scoop Tuesday's and 1. Their "scoop" is really 3 scoops (no complaining here) 2. They have so many flavors to choose from its amazing 3. The staff is friendly and cheerful (always a huge bonus in my book) 

I had the chocolate peanut butter brownie and it was deelish, my hubby had the Chocolate marshmallow also good, my son had the cookie dough and really enjoyed the huge chunks of dough and my youngest had the blue moon which was raspberry and although it was a little too tart for me, she loved it. We will be heading back and taking advantage of their $2 scoop Tuesday
Really, the best ice cream you can find in Vegas. REAL ice cream, not that frozen yogurt bullshit. Chocolate raspberry truffle or the ore-dough will change your life.

Not looking forward to the long line but I will defintiely be back... Its not your typical ice cream you can definitely see why there are so many chains across the nation. they know what they're doing when it comes to ice cream.. Me and the wifey tried the 4 flavor sampler

Banana Cream, Spouse like a house, Butter Pecan, Chocolate Malt Caramel

The ice cream is very thick and creamy also you can taste that it has high content of butter fat so it made your eyes roll back on first bite. I cant wait for us to try more stuff when we come back.  I think the chocolate malt caramel stood out for me as well as the butter pecan. I dont really like banana ice cream but wifey sure did enjoy it.
Best...ice cream...EVER... The menu was a little overwhelming, only because there is so many good flavors! I strongly recommend this place!
Went back again and tried the coffee chip and mint chocolate chip and it was both delicious!!

Seriously Handels??? Who thought of the bright idea to think ppl want to eat their ice cream, I mean soup out in this weather. You couldn't find a way to have some kind of inside seating? And the service was atrocious. The guy at the window could not have been any ruder.  Ice cream was ok but not worth the cost or having to sweat in it while eating. Many other places worth going to than here.
First time here and took everybody's advice on here and got the "Graham Central Station" it was so good and tasty!!! Wish I could taste all the flavors!!! I will definitely be back for more!

The ice cream is great and the employees are either really customer centric, or not. The only issues that I have with this place is the process. They have several windows, most are closed, and theres really no structure to the "line" or "who is next" and theres no apparent process.

The person handwrites your order and disappears. They come back with your items one by one, then when you have to pay, they take your credit card away to a back area to process your charge.

They need a proper POS and ordering system, and they need to make the ordering and payment process simple and transparent.

I fucking love this place. Blue moon and cotton candy are my two favorite. BUT ALL THE FLAVORS ARE SO GOOD!!!! Recommend getting a 4 scoop sampler. 4 scoops of different flavors for like $4-5!!! I get that whenever I don't go on the two buck tuesdays

Good product BUT owner is not very nice.  Not friendly, not welcoming & makes u wait @ the window even if there's no customer.  His employees are nice though.  I use to go @ least 3 times a week & referred many people but after so many chances I stopped going.

Okay, so I absolutely LOVE ice cream, and I was a little disappointed with Handel's.  The ice cream was great, but the customer serivce leaves much to be desired.  


So Handel's offers a large variety of flavors to choose from. Not only that so many different ways to have your ice cream too. It's a bit overwhelming but in a good way!   Also, they are cheap either!  This is a walk up place so don't expect to sit anywhere besides the benches. 

They make ice cream from scratch and you can tell from the flavors and textures. It's smooth and not icy like something that's been sitting and refrozen like other places. Their ice cream really leans on the side of frozen custard.  

I chose the Oreo Cookie Sandwich, which was okay.  But I really enjoyed the Butterfinger Twist, which made every bite come to life.  My brother ordered a Milkshake and he feel absoulty in love with it after the first sip.  Over this is a good place, but I wish it wasn't so far away, and the customer service was more friendlier.

Came here at 920p on a Tuesday. They close at 10p. The line wasn't long at all. Lots of employees working most of the windows were open for service. All the staff are young kids, don't expect the best service from them. I advise the girl it was my first time there but she didn't care to be enthusiastic or helpful in explaining anything. Our interaction was painless since I kinda knew what I wanted already. 

There's no place to sit inside to enjoy your ice cream. It's basically an enclosed ice cream stand. There's a couple park benches you can sit at but other than that you eat in your car or take it home. 

Over by Tropical Smoothie Cafe there's a lot of picnic tables if you wanna walk over there. 

We were there on Tuesday for the $2 deal but opted to get the 4 scoops sampler for $4. We got coconut, Oreos, strawberry cheesecake & graham central station. They were all good. I a sucker for coconut, however, the coconut one was my least favorite. Oreo & graham central station were delicious. They're not the best ice cream I've ever had but it was good & reasonably priced. 

Will definitely be back to try other flavors.

Samples:  Banana Cream Pie, Birthday Cake, Butter Pecan, Salty Caramel Truffle, Midnight 
Madness
Oree-Dough and Graham Central Station
Blondie Sundae with Buckeye and Peanut Butter Parfait, Caramel, Whipped Cream, Cherry

An Ohio native of the Northwest who spent his formative years with Toft's, Friendly's, Breyer's or Soft-Serve before developing a taste for the finer things at Jeni's in Columbus, it really does not seem all that strange that it took 36 years to visit Youngstown-based Handel's Homemade Ice Cream & Yogurt but on Saturday the omission was finally righted, a trip to the Las Vegas Scoop Shop on the corner of Hualapai and Tropicana actually more impressive than one may of thought.

Born in 1945, techniques changed but formulas still using an old-school base with all flavors churned on site, Handel's Las Vegas occupies a somewhat out-of-the-way corner in the western Suburbs and with nothing but tableless benches offered as seating the layout is decidedly grab-and-go only, a few patrons wavering over nearly thirty options while others opted to do some tasting.  

Featuring four windows, though the midday only saw two open as a duo of young ladies provided smiles with the scoops, tastes of Butter Pecan and "Salty Caramel Truffle" reminded me of slow-spun flavors from my childhood, the Banana Cream Pie and Birthday cake trending a bit more over-sweet and artificial while a seasonal special titled "Midnight Madness" delivered all sorts of richness with Dark Chocolate Punched up by Oreos and Reese's Peanut Butter Cups.

Affordable and sizably portioned compared to others, two scoops approximating a pint for just $4.25, it was on the cashier's advice that Graham Central Station was paired to Chocolate-Chip Cookie Dough with a mix-in from Nabisco, the former a lot like eating soggy S'mores while the later was exactly as might be expected, the texture intriguing but overwhelming sweetness difficult to ignore.

Always a sucker for a Sundae, not to mention housemade baked goods, part two of the tasting entailed a warm blondie at the base of a plastic clamshell and although whipped cream and caramel were both no better than store-bought the pairing of Peanut Butter Parfait and a treat from my Home State were as delicious as they were nostalgic, the blend reminding me a lot of Moose-Tracks - a flavor so difficult to track down in my childhood that a  three hour trip to Youngstown may not have been all that bad.

THREE STARS:  Noteworthy for its old school appeal, though nouveau Artisans have long left their flavors and smoothness far behind, Handel's is well served in its suburban strip-mall location, no doubt a step-up from the Midwest to Sin City while still maintaining its nostalgia but by no means 'destination worthy' stuff.

Handel's Ice Cream is AMAZING!!!!  It has to be some of the best ice cream I've ever had!!!  Their customer service is great, and they have so many selections of ice cream flavors!!!  I highly recommend Handel's to anyone and everyone wanting amazing ice cream!!!

Love. My favorite ice cream ever . Ill never eat ice cream from the store or anyplace else ever again !Lots of great flavors. All the ones I have tired so far .Strawberry cheesecake chunk, Chocolate, Strawberry, Mint chocolate chip and my very favorite Deep dish apple pie AMAZING!! Staff is great to! Oh so very patient :) A Big Thanks to the genius guy that brought Handel's to Vegas !

Delicious! I love ice cream!! This place is delicious. I have been trying to find a good place for a milk shake and this is my new place. 

Every flavor I have tried has been great and haven't been disappointed. Whoever is complaining about this ice cream being too sweet is silly! Uh you are eating ice cream dumby! Ice cream is supposed to be sweet. I will come back because it's good. The line doesn't move very quickly because there is only 1 or 2 people working at a time.

This seems to forever be my most favorite Ice cream place, the peanut butter parfait is to die for. Recently tried rolled ice cream all I can say is stay loyal or you may regret.

Staff is always friendly here and so happy Cinnaholic is on the next street over my two favorite dessert places are neighbors

I'm happy there is finally a normal ice cream place in Vegas. I don't want frogurt or gelato or crappy franchised ice cream.
Love that they have tons of options! But the ice cream itself wasn't all that, the texture was a bit gooey, I expected smoother. I had a 4 flavor sampler...I liked the Salted Carmel Pretzel (I think thats the name) and Spouse like a House. I tried the Coconut Cream pie (overly sweet) and the Blue Moon (lacked flavor). Prices are great. Wait staff was friendly and answered all my flavor questions.
They even sell Frosty Paws for your four legged friends, they were out of them when we were there but I didn't mind sharing my ice cream with my fuzzy son.
I will definitely go back. Its close to home and they serve ice cream. Duh!
If you are EVER in the mood for ice cream, I wouldn't go anywhere other than Handel's. Its quick, its delicious and every flavor is an explosion to your taste buds! Absolutely love it!

I'll start off by saying that I'm completely biased toward Handel's. I'm from Youngstown, Ohio where this ice cream chain originated not 10-20 years ago, but 70 years ago. Because I've been eating this ice cream since the 80s, this ice cream is my standard and what I use to compare everything else.

As far as their service procedure, one person is at the window and he/she takes your order, makes it, and cashes you out. Everything is made when ordered, including hand packing the pints and quarts. There are no seating  areas aside from a few benches. This is the way it's done at the original Handel's on Market and Midlothian in which you go and wait at least 15-20 minutes in line and you eat ice cream inside or outside your car. Should they continue this procedure like it's 1945? Absolutely not and hopefully they'll make some changes. For now, just be prepared for the wait and to enjoy your ice cream somewhere else beside a table or bench.

We shared the banana split this last visit and it was the same delicious ice cream as it always is. Some may think the sweetness and creaminess factors are high, but they are just right to me. 70 years worth of satisfied customers will also agree with me.
Love the selections of ice-cream and variety of sizes to enjoy on the benches when out walking or take home for friends to enjoy.

Yum!!! Worth the drive!!

Banana cream pie, Midnight Madness, Coconut Almond Ripple, and their Graham Central Station !!  $4.25 for a 4 scoop sampler.... worth it!!

Best ice cream in vegas!!

My fave flavors so far are:
Banana cream pie
Chocolate pecan
Oreo
Salted caramel

Customer service is amazing too!! Can't wait to try all the flavors!!
Tasty and original flavors, especially spouse like a house and graham central station.  Friendly staff and definitely somewhere I will visit again!

Omg amazing!!!! Need I say anymore ... 
Nutella , key lime pie , butter pecan , deep dish apple pie are all ridiculously good ! Be sure to try it out

Ok.... so I may be a little biased because the first 29 years of my life I lived in the heart of Cleveland Ohio...but this ice cream is 1.BOMB 2. So homey 3. The staff is so friendly, clean, speedy and incredibly good polite all I can say is get the BUCKEYE!!!!!!!  Attention owners I LOVE YOU and thank you for being so Ohio loyal and awesome!
The best ice cream in Vegas!  The shop is impeccable and so friendly!  Do yourself a favor and run, don't walk, to treat yourself!

Ice cream is great but outside windows only in 108 temps not cool no where near enough staff for the long lines 4 windows and 2 workers I will most likely not go back too bad they have great ice cream
This place is amazing! We loved every bite! Nice to have awesome service as well - this is now our go to ice cream shop!

Love love love Handels Ice Cream, especially on $2 Tuesday!! You can't beat that deal and it's worth waiting in line. My girls lean towards the cookies n cream but when we steer them to try a new flavor they always like or love it. They also have excellent tasting non dairy options for those who prefer or need that. For myself I pretty much read the entire flavor menu each time only to choose Blueberry Cobbler. I can't stop ordering it, soooooooo good!! I'm never disappointed. 
If you live close to Summerlin, Handels is a must try.

Love this place. Specialty blends and signature treats. Soooo good. The pack pints and quarts. Reasonable prices.
Ez walk up windows.
Disappoint that I couldn't get a hurricane 15 minutes before they closed. The worker told me they don't do hurricanes 15 prior to closing. Did i miss that on the website?
For the one scoop big serving for two bucks every tuesday, totally worth it! All of the flavors are amazing.

It's pretty good. It's nice that you can choose the sampler pack and get 4 scoops of different flavor a. My wife is keen on the coconut cream pie flavor, so we end up coming here quite a bit for simply just that.
Came here and was a great experience the ice cream was fantastic the staff was very friendly would strongly recommend this place for anyone and all ages can't go wrong here!!!
Awesome ice cream shop from Ohio that is made at each location. Plenty of flavors and great prices

Another new dessert spot serving frozen carbs has opened up.  I've never heard of Handel's before which is kind of bad since it was born in Ohio and so was I; I'm not a good Buckeye, apparently.  We came by on the first night of opening because Yelpers have FOMO like that.  I didn't know it was an outdoor establishment where you order at the counter; there's no place to eat indoors.  Because of this fact, our group of friends was standing around in a circle eating our ice cream, trying to create body warmth amongst us while we ate spoonfuls of frozen sugar; go figure.  There are a plethora of flavors to choose from, making it difficult to choose.  Thankfully, there is a 4 scoop sampler available for $4.25, which was just perfect.  The b/f chose two flavors and I chose the other two, which were Chocolate Peanut Butter Brownie, Cherry Cordial, Spouse Like a House (Louse? Mouse?), and Buckeye.  Spouse Like a House, the flavor with a funny name, is vanilla ice cream with chocolate-covered peanut butter pretzels and it's delicious.  I also liked Buckeye, which has chocolate-peanut butter candies shaped like the nut of Ohio's state tree.  Actually, all four flavors were fabulous.  I can foresee this place being popular with the Bishop Gorman students since their campus is right down the street, as well as any other ice cream lover.  Welcome to town, Handel's, a bit of Youngstown now in Las Vegas.
It's good . The owner kind of genius imo as you can't walk in the store and you can only see it and Order from the walk up window making all Their customer standing place is free rent.

Always saw a line so thought, "this must be good." I went on $2 Tuesday. The line was really super long. I waited 40 minutes in the sun. When I finally reached the front of the line, a mean elderly lady cut me. The lady argued could cut everyone because no one was ready to order but her. This upset everyone waiting in the sun even more. When I ordered, the guy at the window slowly took my order, would come back, hand me an ice cream, then tediously  leave and close the window to go get another ice cream. There has to be a better system! It is not that this the world's best ice cream and people are lining up, getting speedy service, and leaving. People have to stand in a line for a long, long time. So do not get deceived with the long line of people like I did. Regarding the ice cream, I thought the ice cream was too sweet. Besides the long line which requires standing within a bunch of angry, frustrated consumers, there are only three benches to sit and eat your ice cream. They should add some ice cream tables.

This is one of the most underrated ice cream places I have ever been to. I first tried it near Rancho Cucamonga when I was in California, and I fell in love with the texture of the icecream and the flavors. It's just so creamy and rich. The flavors are so creative and delicious. Now, I come here all the time. The service is quick. The icecream is inexpensive, and you get gigantic scoops. The flavors are so on point - especially the strawberry cheesecake!!!! It's a must-try. You wouldn't know it's right beside the Smith's grocery on Tropicana. It's kind of a hidden gem. You definitely have to try this place.

Such a delicious treat! We were getting sick of all the frozen yogurt places and this hit the spot. The ice cream is perfectly creamy (not too hard and not too soft). The flavors are so yummy! We had mint choc chip, choc chip cookie dough, chocolate and strawberry. We also had a milkshake which was one of the best milkshakes I've ever had! These were so good we wanted to try more! This is our new favorite spot! A definite must try!

I love this ice cream!!!

The owner is super nice too.  He played with the kids through he window and doors; ice cream and free entertainment!! What else can we ask for??

We been here a lot of times and we have never been disappointed. The only downside is there's not a lot of seating outside.

I am from the other side of the US. I am reporting that Handel's Ice Cream has BLUE MOON during the summer months!

This place is a serious drive for me, but SO worth it! Their ice cream selection choice is amazing. Although there is no "inside" place to sit, that doesn't bother me - because BLUE MOON. (Although when it is 120 degrees outside, then it might bother me a little...)

You order at a window. But BLUE MOON. 

That is all.

Slight disclaimer, considering that it was Vegas in June. But this place was better than advertised. I'm a life-long ice cream man, and I have tasted some good stuff. This was the best I've ever had in Vegas, hands down.

Tons of different flavors to choose from. Almost problematically so, because every flavor is equally great. They do a 4-flavor sampler which is a great option, because then you can become addicted to multiple flavors, rather than just one.

It is a slightly odd setup. No interior seats or tables. You walk-up to the window and order and pay right there. Not a problem, just different, that's all. We found it because some lady on Family Feud said it was the best.

I will definitely be going back, but I wish they had more locations in Vegas. This one is located a long way from everything in Vegas, and could be more convenient.

I would get ice cream here everyday if i could. 1 minute from my house! Handels is one of those places where you just walk up to to the window and order. Its like a glorified ice cream stand lol. One thing I like is the amount of flavors!!! They have classic flavors and new flavors! I usually get the 4 scoop sampler because I can never decide on one flavor. The service is always nice here but sometimes they have long lines. If you live around here you know theres a lot of ice cream in this area but this is my go-to.

Great little place but it's not a place to hang out as there's no inside seating. There's a few benches and grassy area, but the storefront is located at the entrance of the strip mall.

There's 100's of flavors to choose from, and they even have flavors of the month.  You can ask for a sample, especially for those with vague descriptions like Graham Central Station.  

Prices aren't cheap, about $3.50 for a scoop.  It was a nice scoop, and you can even say a generous scoop, but its still one scoop of ice cream.

Was it the best ice cream I've ever had? Hmm, not sure. It was good, and it hit the spot on a warm Memorial Day evening.

First trip there was a mix-up with my order, the service was friendly, and the ice cream was good, manager said they would fix things. Second trip order was perfect, ice cream was great,  service terrific (wish I had gotten the young man's name). The manager had taken care of the problem. Really can't wait to try one of their shakes.
Amazing ice cream! Sooooo yummy. So many different flavors to choose from and great customer service. So glad I found this place! 2 buck Tuesday's are everything!

Handel's is easily my favorite place to go for ice cream! Not only is their $2 Tuesday a great deal, its actually more like 3 or 4 scoops rather than the advertised 2. They consistently have new seasonal flavors but every time I go I have to order my all time favorite, blueberry cobbler! The coconut creme pie was a close second but unfortunately they don't carry it any more. Pro tip: keep an eye out for their coupons in the mail!

It's so nice to have an ice cream place in Vegas. Real ice cream. Too bad they don't have an indoor area to sit down and enjoy. This is a service window only type establishment. 

Large selection of flavors. I bought a handpacked pint of Salty Caramel Truffle ($4.95) then went back for a hot fudge sundae made with Cherry Cordial the next night ($4.75). I think their best deal is the 4 scoop sampler for $4.75.

The ice cream is pretty good. It's not Tillamook Ice Cream good, but its pretty good. The hot fudge sundae could have been a little bigger, and had some peanuts. It's probably 3.5 stars but since its ice cream and semi-local I rounded up. 

$2 single cones on Tuesdays.

I used to pass by this place and wonder why there was always long lines. I finally stopped one day and I am so happy I did! I get the 4 scoop sampler every time I go and I have yet to find a flavor that I DO NOT like. Birthday Cake and Banana Cream Pie are my top two.
Amazing selection of ice cream. Their hurricanes and sundaes have all been delicious. $2 Tuesdays for a scoop is great to try their flavors.

Is this the best ice cream ever? No. 
But I guess people go cuz it's inexpensive and tastes good enough. 
I got a 4 scoop combo for less than $5. What a deal. 

Spouse like a house was my fave flavor. A great choice for peanut butter lovers. I'm not a huge fan but this was gooooood. Oh man, it was like eating Reese's butter cups but an ice cream version or something. Imagine a cold or sit butter mouse cake. Mmmmmmmmm. We also got grape. Such an odd choice but this was also my top fave flavor. Would def go back for these two. 

I think I'll skip the Oreo and the salted caramel. I'd rather eat Haagen Daz for Oreo or that fancy shmancy McConell's salted caramel which is only sold at whole foods. 

Will be back for SPOUSE LIKE A IZZ HOUSEEEEEE. In da Handel's house southwest saaaiiiiiiide!

Best ice cream in Las Vegas! Might even be the best I have had anywhere. My go to flavors are the Butter Pecan and Salty Caramel Truffle. I have sampled many other flavors and haven't found one that I haven't liked.
My favorite ice cream with a wide variety of flavors but I like the pineapple sherbet shake the best especially on a hot summer's day.

Stopped by for an afternoon treat and tried the 4 scoop sampler.  What a bargain $4 for 4 scoops.  This would've set you back $12 at Baskin Robbins. My favorite flavor of the 4 was Salted Caramel Truffle.

Great, wonderful ice cream - but the service is horrible.  Workers take orders, get the ice cream and take payment.  It is slow and leads to long waits.  It really hurts the experience for a wonderful product.

I like this place, I really do, however, they are not kid friendly.  I have a 3 and 5 year old.  They cannot eat 2.5 scoops of ice cream.  I cannot stand how they have NO kid size servings.  I am able to split the single serving into a cup and cone, but it has to be the same flavor.  Seriously?  Have you ever met a 3 and 5 year old who can agree on anything, let alone any flavor of ice cream?  I haven't and it's super annoying.  McDonald's dollar comes here we come!!

Loving all the new businesses opening in my hood. Finally got to check this place out the other day. I couldn't believe the variety of flavors they offered. Everything from vanilla Oreo to Graham Central Station, the classics, and everything in between. Sooooooo many options!! (Reference to Shaqtin' A Fool ) They have sundaes, shakes, cones and I believe some other options. Prices are reasonable. I paid less than five dollars for a waffle cone with a large amount of ice cream. The young man at the window was so polite! I'm a happy camper and will frequent this little find especially now that summer is quickly approaching.

Came to Handel's for the first time with a group of friends a long long time ago, back when Kauai Cafe was still in this plaza. I didn't even know that this was an ice cream place because of the walk-up window. That's how they keep this place really clean, by not having a store with constant foot traffic. Smart, I suppose. They have a pretty big menu - cones, sundaes, smoothies, hurricanes, etc. So many flavors of ice cream, but I decided to be boring and try the Oreo. It really was nothing special. I am fine with my Dreyer's Cookies 'N Cream ice cream that I have at home.

Anyway, didn't come back here for a while since I am actually a fan of Thrifty's ice cream at Sweet Addiction. When I ended up here again for the second time, I decided to order the Raspberry Sherbet Parfait since it looked good in the picture. Daaang, it was delicious! Can't even remember the last time I actually had good Sherbet, but this is the only reason why I keep coming back! Although, the amount that you get is a hit or miss depending on the employee who makes it. Sometimes the scoops are huge and stacked high, and sometimes the scoops are just sad. 

The lines can be long during the summer. Maybe I'll try other flavors of their ice cream in the future, but for now I am definitely a fan of their Sherbet!

Having been to Handel's on a number of occasions, I was looking forward to the new location opening in the area.

I arrived around noon on their opening day. There are so many great flavors to choose from I decided to get a more conventional flavor, the chocolate raspberry truffle in a cake cone. 

Flavors were solid and I'm happy to have another dessert option on the Southwest side of town. I think adding some outdoor seating might be a nice next step for this location, to mirror others I have visited.
Best strawberry cheesecake ice cream ever. My boyfriend and I come here probably two or three times a week...hehe. If you're an ice cream lover I definitely recommend this place to you.

Came here for $2 scoop Tuesdays for the first time not too long ago. Tried a scoop of the strawberry cheesecake and my husband got the ore dough flavor. I really liked both and we bought a point of the grahm Central station for home since we tried that before at a friend's house. 

I like how their scoops are generous and they have a lot of flavors to choose from. The line was pretty long since they had that promotion, but it goes by quick with the amount of workers helping out each customer. 

I would recommend if you're in the neighborhood to come check them out and try one of their many flavors of ice cream.
